  8512 00000258 E96BFF                  		jmp	z_bus_exit
  8513                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8514                                  
  8515                                  ;************************************************************************
  8516                                  ;*									*
  8517                                  ;*	prnstat - utility function to call ROM BIOS to check		*
  8518                                  ;*		 printer status. Return meaningful error code		*
  8519                                  ;*									*
  8520                                  ;************************************************************************
  8521                                  
  8522                                  prnstat:				
  8523 0000025B B402                    		mov	ah, 2		; set command for get status
  8524                                  					; PRINTER - GET	STATUS
  8525                                  					; DX = printer port (0-3)
  8526                                  					; Return: AH = status
  8527                                  
  8528                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8529                                  
  8530                                  ;************************************************************************
  8531                                  ;*									*
  8532                                  ;*	prnop - call ROM BIOS printer function in ah			*
  8533                                  ;*		return zero true if no error				*
  8534                                  ;*		return zero false if error, al = error code		*
  8535                                  ;*									*
  8536                                  ;************************************************************************
  8537                                  
  8538                                  prnop:	
  8539 0000025D 8B16[2100]              		mov	dx, [auxnum]	; get printer number
  8540 00000261 CD17                    		int	17h
  8541                                  
  8542                                  	; This check was added to see if this is a case of no
  8543                                  	; printer being installed. This tests checks to be sure
  8544                                  	; the error is noprinter (30h)
  8545                                  
  8546 00000263 50                      		push	ax
  8547 00000264 80E430                  		and	ah, 30h
  8548 00000267 80FC30                  		cmp	ah, 30h		; noprinter
  8549 0000026A 58                      		pop	ax
  8550 0000026B 7506                    		jnz	short NextTest
  8551 0000026D 80E4DF                  		and	ah, 0DFh	; ~nopaperstatus
  8552 00000270 80CC08                  		or	ah, 8		; ioerrstatus
  8553                                  
  8554                                  ; examine the status bits to see if an error occurred. unfortunately, several
  8555                                  ; of the bits are set so we have to pick and choose. we must be extremely
  8556                                  ; careful about breaking basic.
  8557                                  
  8558                                  NextTest:				
  8559 00000273 F6C428                  		test	ah, 28h		; (ioerrstatus+nopaperstatus)
  8560                                  					; i/o error?
  8561 00000276 740A                    		jz	short checknotready ; no, try not ready
  8562                                  
  8563                                  ; at this point, we know we have an error. the converse is not true
  8564                                  
  8565 00000278 B009                    		mov	al, 9		; error_I24_out_of_paper
  8566                                  					; first, assume	out of paper
  8567 0000027A F6C420                  		test	ah, 20h		; out of paper set?
  8568 0000027D 7502                    		jnz	short ret1	; yes, error is	set
  8569 0000027F FEC0                    		inc	al		; return al=10 (i/o error)
  8570                                  ret1:					
  8571 00000281 C3                      		retn
  8572                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8573                                  
  8574                                  checknotready:				
  8575 00000282 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; assume not-ready
  8576 00000284 F6C401                  		test	ah, 1
  8577 00000287 C3                      		retn
  8578                                  
  8579                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8580                                  
  8581                                  ;************************************************************************
  8582                                  ;*									*
  8583                                  ;*	prn_tilbusy - output until busy. Used by print spooler.		*
  8584                                  ;*		     this entry point should never block waiting for	*
  8585                                  ;*		     device to come ready.				*
  8586                                  ;*									*
  8587                                  ;*	inputs:	cx = count, es:di -> buffer				*
  8588                                  ;*	outputs: set the number of bytes transferred in the		*
  8589                                  ;*		 device driver request packet				*
  8590                                  ;*									*
  8591                                  ;************************************************************************
  8592                                  
  8593                                  		; 19/10/2022
  8594                                  prn_tilbusy:				; 2C7h:28Bh = 70h:27FBh
  8595 00000288 89FE                    		mov	si, di		; everything is	set for	lodsb
  8596                                  prn_tilbloop:				
  8597 0000028A 51                      		push	cx
  8598 0000028B 53                      		push	bx
  8599 0000028C 30FF                    		xor	bh, bh
  8600 0000028E 8A1E[E704]              		mov	bl, [printdev]
  8601 00000292 D1E3                    		shl	bx, 1
  8602                                  		;mov	cx, ds:wait_count[bx] ;	wait count times to come ready
  8603 00000294 8B8F[E804]              		mov	cx, [wait_count+bx]
  8604 00000298 5B                      		pop	bx
  8605                                  prn_getstat:				
  8606 00000299 E8BFFF                  		call	prnstat		; get status
  8607 0000029C 7514                    		jnz	short prn_bperr	; error
  8608 0000029E F6C480                  		test	ah, 80h		; ready	yet?
  8609 000002A1 E1F6                    		loope	prn_getstat	; no, go for more
  8610 000002A3 59                      		pop	cx		; get original count
  8611 000002A4 740D                    		jz	short prn_berr	; still	not ready => done
  8612 000002A6 26                      		es
  8613 000002A7 AC                      		lodsb
  8614                                  		;lods	byte ptr es:[si] ; es
  8615                                  					; lodsb
  8616 000002A8 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  8617 000002AA E8B0FF                  		call	prnop
  8618 000002AD 7504                    		jnz	short prn_berr	; error
  8619 000002AF E2D9                    		loop	prn_tilbloop
  8620                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8621                                  		; cf=0 (prnop)
  8622                                  		;clc			; normal no-error return
  8623 000002B1 C3                      		retn			;   from device driver
  8624                                  
  8625                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8626                                  
  8627                                  prn_bperr:				
  8628 000002B2 59                      		pop	cx		; restore transfer count from stack
  8629                                  prn_berr:				
  8630 000002B3 E921FE                  		jmp	bc_err_cnt
  8631                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8632                                  
  8633                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8634                                  
  8635                                  ;************************************************************************
  8636                                  ;*									*
  8637                                  ;*	prn_genioctl - get/set printer retry count			*
  8638                                  ;*									*
  8639                                  ;************************************************************************
  8640                                  
  8641                                  ; IOCTL.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  8642                                  ; 11/01/2019
  8643                                  
  8644                                  ;********************************;*
  8645                                  ; CHARACTER DEVICES (PRINTERS)	 ;*
  8646                                  ;********************************;*
  8647                                  
  8648                                  ;;RAWIO SUB-FUNCTIONS
  8649                                  ;;get_retry_count equ 65h
  8650                                  ;;set_retry_count equ 45h
  8651                                  
  8652                                  ;;struc A_RETRYCOUNT
  8653                                  ;;.rc_count: resw 1
  8654                                  ;;endstruc
  8655                                  
  8656                                  ;ioc_pc equ 5
  8657                                  
  8658                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8659                                  
  8660                                  		; 19/10/2022
  8661                                  prn_genioctl:				; 2C7h:2BAh = 70h:282Ah
  8662 000002B6 C43E[1200]              		les	di, [ptrsav]
  8663 000002BA 26807D0D05              		cmp	byte [es:di+13], 5 ; [es:di+IOCTL_REQ.MAJORFUNCTION]
  8664                                  					; ioc_pc
  8665 000002BF 7403                    		jz	short prnfunc_ok
  8666                                  
  8667                                  prnfuncerr:				
  8668 000002C1 E911FE                  		jmp	bc_cmderr
  8669                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8670                                  
  8671                                  prnfunc_ok:				
  8672 000002C4 268A450E                		mov	al, [es:di+14]	; [es:di+IOCTL_REQ.MINORFUNCTION]
  8673 000002C8 26C47D13                		les	di, [es:di+19]	; [es:di+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
  8674 000002CC 30FF                    		xor	bh, bh
  8675                                  		;mov	bl, ds:printdev	; get index into retry counts
  8676 000002CE 8A1E[E704]              		mov	bl, [printdev]
  8677 000002D2 D1E3                    		shl	bx, 1
  8678                                  		;mov	cx, ds:wait_count[bx] ;	pull out retry count for device
  8679 000002D4 8B8F[E804]              		mov	cx, [wait_count+bx]
  8680 000002D8 3C65                    		cmp	al, 65h		; get_retry_count
  8681 000002DA 7407                    		jz	short prngetcount
  8682 000002DC 3C45                    		cmp	al, 45h		; set_retry_count
  8683 000002DE 75E1                    		jnz	short prnfuncerr
  8684 000002E0 268B0D                  		mov	cx, [es:di]
  8685                                  prngetcount:				
  8686                                  		;mov	ds:wait_count[bx], cx
  8687 000002E3 898F[E804]              		mov	[wait_count+bx], cx
  8688 000002E7 26890D                  		mov	[es:di], cx	; [es:di+A_RETRYCOUNT.RC_COUNT]
  8689                                  					; return current retry count
  8690                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8691                                  		; cf=0
  8692                                  		;clc
  8693 000002EA C3                      		retn
  8694                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8695                                  
  8696                                  ;************************************************************************
  8697                                  ;*									*
  8698                                  ;*  prn_ioctl_query							*
  8699                                  ;*									*
  8700                                  ;*  Added for 5.00							*
  8701                                  ;************************************************************************
  8702

  8724                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8725                                  
  8726                                  ;************************************************************************
  8727                                  ;*									*
  8728                                  ;*	aux port driver code -- "aux" == "com1"				*
  8729                                  ;*									*
  8730                                  ;*	the device driver entry/dispatch code sets up auxnum to		*
  8731                                  ;*	give the com port number to use (0=com1, 1=com2, 2=com3...)	*
  8732                                  ;*									*
  8733                                  ;************************************************************************
  8734                                  
  8735                                  ;	values in ah, requesting function of int 14h in rom bios
  8736                                  
  8737                                  ;auxfunc_send	 equ	1	;transmit
  8738                                  ;auxfunc_receive equ	2	;read
  8739                                  ;auxfunc_status	 equ	3	;request status
  8740                                  
  8741                                  ;	error flags, reported by int 14h, reported in ah:
  8742                                  
  8743                                  ;flag_data_ready equ	01h	;data ready
  8744                                  ;flag_overrun	 equ	02h	;overrun error
  8745                                  ;flag_parity	 equ	04h	;parity error
  8746                                  ;flag_frame	 equ	08h	;framing error
  8747                                  ;flag_break	 equ	10h	;break detect
  8748                                  ;flag_tranhol_emp equ	20h	;transmit holding register empty
  8749                                  ;flag_timeout	 equ	80h	;timeout
  8750                                  
  8751                                  ;	these flags reported in al:
  8752                                  
  8753                                  ;flag_cts	 equ	10h	;clear to send
  8754                                  ;flag_dsr	 equ	20h	;data set ready
  8755                                  ;flag_rec_sig	 equ	80h	;receive line signal detect
  8756                                  
  8757                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8758                                  
  8759                                  ;************************************************************************
  8760                                  ;*									*
  8761                                  ;*	aux_read - read cx bytes from [auxnum] aux port to buffer	*
  8762                                  ;*		   at es:di						*
  8763                                  ;*									*
  8764                                  ;************************************************************************
  8765                                  
  8766                                  aux_read:				; 2C7h:30Dh = 70h:287Dh
  8767                                  		;jcxz	short exvec2
  8768 00000306 E311                    		jcxz	exvec2		; 19/10/2022
  8769 00000308 E87700                  		call	getbx		; put address of auxbuf	in bx
  8770 0000030B 30C0                    		xor	al, al
  8771 0000030D 8607                    		xchg	al, [bx]
  8772 0000030F 08C0                    		or	al, al
  8773 00000311 7503                    		jnz	short aux2
  8774                                  aux1:					
  8775 00000313 E80500                  		call	auxin		; get character	from port
  8776                                  					; won't return if error
  8777                                  aux2:					
  8778 00000316 AA                      		stosb
  8779 00000317 E2FA                    		loop	aux1		; if more characters, go around	again
  8780                                  exvec2:					
  8781 00000319 F8                      		clc			; all done, successful exit
  8782                                  auxin_retn:	; 18/12/2022
  8783 0000031A C3                      		retn
  8784                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8785                                  
  8786                                  ;************************************************************************
  8787                                  ;*									*
  8788                                  ;*	auxin - call rom bios to read character from aux port		*
  8789                                  ;*		if error occurs, map the error and return one		*
  8790                                  ;*		level up to device driver exit code, setting		*
  8791                                  ;*		the number of bytes transferred appropriately		*
  8792                                  ;*									*
  8793                                  ;************************************************************************
  8794                                  
  8795                                  auxin:					
  8796 0000031B B402                    		mov	ah, 2		; auxfunc_receive
  8797 0000031D E83C00                  		call	auxop
  8798 00000320 F6C40E                  		test	ah, 0Eh		; flag_frame|flag_parity|flag_overrun
  8799                                  		;jnz	short arbad	; skip if any error bits set
  8800                                  		;retn
  8801                                  		; 25/06/2023 (BugFix)
  8802 00000323 74F5                    		jz	short auxin_retn
  8803                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8804                                  
  8805                                  arbad:					
  8806 00000325 58                      		pop	ax		; remove return	address	(near call)
  8807 00000326 30C0                    		xor	al, al
  8808 00000328 0CB0                    		or	al, 0B0h	; flag_rec_sig|	flag_dsr|flag_cts
  8809 0000032A E9AAFD                  		jmp	bc_err_cnt
  8810                                  
  8811                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8812                                  
  8813                                  ;************************************************************************
  8814                                  ;*									*
  8815                                  ;*	aux_rdnd - non-destructive aux port read			*
  8816                                  ;*									*
  8817                                  ;************************************************************************
  8818                                  
  8819                                  aux_rdnd:				; 2C7h:335h = 70h:28A5h
  8820 0000032D E85200                  		call	getbx
  8821 00000330 8A07                    		mov	al, [bx]	; have bx point	to auxbuf
  8822 00000332 08C0                    		or	al, al		; if al	is non-zero (char in buffer)
  8823 00000334 7511                    		jnz	short auxdrx	; then return character
  8824 00000336 E82100                  		call	auxstat		; if not, get status of	aux device
  8825 00000339 F6C401                  		test	ah, 1		; flag_data_ready - test data ready
  8826 0000033C 740C                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  8827 0000033E A820                    		test	al, 20h		; flag_dsr - test data set ready
  8828 00000340 7408                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  8829 00000342 E8D6FF                  		call	auxin		; else aux is ready, get character
  8830 00000345 8807                    		mov	[bx], al
  8831                                  auxdrx:					
  8832 00000347 E9A7FE                  		jmp	rdexit		; return busy status
  8833                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8834                                  
  8835                                  auxbus:					
  8836 0000034A E979FE                  		jmp	z_bus_exit
  8837                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8838                                  
  8839                                  ;************************************************************************
  8840                                  ;*									*
  8841                                  ;*	aux_wrst - return aux port write status				*
  8842                                  ;*									*
  8843                                  ;************************************************************************
  8844                                  
  8845                                  aux_wrst:				; 2C7h:355h = 70h:28C5h

  8848 00000352 74F6                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  8849 00000354 F6C420                  		test	ah, 20h		; flag_tranhol_emp - test transmit hold	reg empty
  8850 00000357 74F1                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  8851                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8852                                  		; cf=0	; (test instruction resets cf)
  8853                                  		;clc
  8854 00000359 C3                      		retn
  8855                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8856                                  
  8857                                  ;************************************************************************
  8858                                  ;*									*
  8859                                  ;*	auxstat - call rom bios to determine aux port status		*
  8860                                  ;*									*
  8861                                  ;*	exit:	ax = status						*
  8862                                  ;*		dx = [auxnum]						*
  8863                                  ;*									*
  8864                                  ;************************************************************************
  8865                                  
  8866                                  auxstat:				
  8867 0000035A B403                    		mov	ah, 3		; auxfunc_status
  8868                                  
  8869                                  		; fall into auxop
  8870                                  
  8871                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8872                                  
  8873                                  ;************************************************************************
  8874                                  ;*									*
  8875                                  ;*	auxop - perform rom-biox aux port interrupt			*
  8876                                  ;*									*
  8877                                  ;*	entry:	ah = int 14h function number				*
  8878                                  ;*	exit:	ax = results						*
  8879                                  ;*		dx = [auxnum]						*
  8880                                  ;*									*
  8881                                  ;************************************************************************
  8882                                  
  8883                                  auxop:		; proc near		
  8884 0000035C 8B16[2100]              		mov	dx, [auxnum]	; ah=function code
  8885                                  					; 0=init, 1=send, 2=receive, 3=status
  8886                                  					; get port number
  8887 00000360 CD14                    		int	14h		; SERIAL I/O - GET USART STATUS
  8888                                  					; DX = port number (0-3)
  8889                                  					; Return: AX = port status code
  8890 00000362 C3                      		retn
  8891                                  
  8892                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8893                                  
  8894                                  ;************************************************************************
  8895                                  ;*									*
  8896                                  ;*	aux_flsh - flush aux input buffer - set contents of		*
  8897                                  ;*		   auxbuf [auxnum] to zero				*
  8898                                  ;*									*
  8899                                  ;*	cas - shouldn't this code call the rom bios input function	*
  8900                                  ;*	      repeatedly until it isn't ready?  to flush out any	*
  8901                                  ;*	      pending serial input queue if there's a tsr like MODE	*
  8902                                  ;*	      which is providing interrupt-buffering of aux port?	*
  8903                                  ;*									*
  8904                                  ;************************************************************************
  8905                                  
  8906                                  aux_flsh:				; 2C7h:36Ch = 70h:28DCh
  8907 00000363 E81C00                  		call	getbx		; flush	aux input buffer
  8908 00000366 C60700                  		mov	byte [bx], 0	; get bx to point to auxbuf
  8909                                  					; zero out buffer
  8910                                  		;clc			; all done, successful return
  8911                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8912                                  		; cf=0 ('add' instruction in 'getbx')
  8913 00000369 C3                      		retn
  8914                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8915                                  
  8916                                  ;************************************************************************
  8917                                  ;*									*
  8918                                  ;*	aux_writ - write to aux device					*
  8919                                  ;*									*
  8920                                  ;************************************************************************
  8921                                  
  8922                                  aux_writ:				; 2C7h:374h = 70h:28E4h
  8923                                  		;jcxz	short exvec2	; write	to aux device (if cx > 0)
  8924 0000036A E3AD                    		jcxz	exvec2		; 19/10/2022
  8925                                  aux_loop:				
  8926 0000036C 268A05                  		mov	al, [es:di]	; get character	to be written
  8927                                  					; move di pointer to next character
  8928 0000036F 47                      		inc	di
  8929 00000370 B401                    		mov	ah, 1		; auxfunc_send - indicates a write
  8930 00000372 E8E7FF                  		call	auxop		; send character over aux port
  8931 00000375 F6C480                  		test	ah, 80h		; check	for error
  8932 00000378 7405                    		jz	short awok	; then no error
  8933 0000037A B00A                    		mov	al, 10		; else indicate	write fault
  8934 0000037C E958FD                  		jmp	bc_err_cnt	; call error routines
  8935                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8936                                  
  8937                                  awok:					
  8938 0000037F E2EB                    		loop	aux_loop	; if cx	is non-zero,
  8939                                  					; still	more character to print
  8940                                  		;clc			; all done, successful return
  8941                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8942                                  		; cf=0 (test instruction above)	
  8943 00000381 C3                      		retn
  8944                                  
  8945                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8946                                  
  8947                                  ;************************************************************************
  8948                                  ;*									*
  8949                                  ;*	getbx - return bx -> single byte input buffer for		*
  8950                                  ;*		selected aux port ([auxnum])				*
  8951                                  ;*									*
  8952                                  ;************************************************************************
  8953                                  
  8954                                  getbx:	
  8955 00000382 8B1E[2100]              		mov	bx, [auxnum]	; return bx -> single byte input buffer
  8956                                  					; for selected aux port	([auxnum])
  8957                                  		;add	bx, offset auxbuf
  8958 00000386 81C3[1600]              		add	bx, auxbuf	; 19/10/2022
  8959                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8960                                  		; cf=0 (if [uaxnum] is valid number) 
  8961 0000038A C3                      		retn
  8962                                  
  8963                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8964                                  
  8965                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8966                                  
  8967                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  8968                                  ;								:
  8969                                  ;		    clock device driver 			:
  8970                                  ;								:
  8971                                  ;								:
  8972                                  ;   this file contains the clock device driver. 		:
  8973                                  ;								:
  8974                                  ;   the routines in this files are:				:
  8975                                  ;								:
  8976                                  ;	routine 		function			:
  8977                                  ;	------- 		--------			:
  8978                                  ;	tim_writ		set the current time		:
  8979                                  ;	tim_read		read the current time		:
  8980                                  ;	time_to_ticks		convert time to corresponding	:
  8981                                  ;				  number of clock ticks 	:
  8982                                  ;								:
  8983                                  ; the clock ticks at the rate of:				:
  8984                                  ;								:
  8985                                  ;	1193180/65536 ticks/second (about 18.2 ticks per second):
  8986                                  ; see each routine for information on the use.			:
  8987                                  ;								:
  8988                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  8989                                  
  8990                                  ; convert time to ticks
  8991                                  ; input : time in cx and dx
  8992                                  ; ticks returned in cx:dx
  8993                                  
  8994                                  ;19/07/2019
  8995                                  ;09/03/2019
  8996                                  
  8997                                  time_to_ticks:				; 0070h:2906h =	02C7h:0396h
  8998                                  
  8999                                  ; first convert from hour,min,sec,hund. to
  9000                                  ; total number of 100th of seconds
  9001                                  
  9002 0000038B B03C                    		mov	al, 60
  9003 0000038D F6E5                    		mul	ch		; hours	to minutes
  9004 0000038F B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  9005 00000391 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; total	minutes
  9006 00000393 B97017                  		mov	cx, 6000	; 60*100
  9007 00000396 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; get out of the way of	the multiply
  9008 00000398 F7E1                    		mul	cx		; convert to 1/100 sec
  9009 0000039A 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax
  9010 0000039C B064                    		mov	al, 100
  9011 0000039E F6E7                    		mul	bh		; convert seconds to 1/100 sec
  9012 000003A0 01C1                    		add	cx, ax		; combine seconds with hours and min
  9013 000003A2 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; ripple carry
  9014 000003A5 B700                    		mov	bh, 0
  9015 000003A7 01D9                    		add	cx, bx		; combine 1/100	sec
  9016 000003A9 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  9017                                  
  9018                                  	; dx:cx is time in 1/100 sec
  9019                                  
  9020 000003AC 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9021 000003AD 91                      		xchg	ax, cx		; now time is in cx:ax
  9022 000003AE BB0BE9                  		mov	bx, 59659
  9023 000003B1 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply low half
  9024 000003B3 87D1                    		xchg	dx, cx
  9025 000003B5 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; cx->ax, ax->dx, dx->cx
  9026 000003B6 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply high	half
  9027 000003B8 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; combine overlapping products
  9028 000003BA 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  9029 000003BD 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; ax:dx=time*59659
  9030 000003BE BB0500                  		mov	bx, 5
  9031 000003C1 F6F3                    		div	bl		; divide high half by 5
  9032 000003C3 88C1                    		mov	cl, al
  9033 000003C5 B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  9034 000003C7 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; remainder of divide-by-5
  9035 000003C9 98                      		cbw
  9036 000003CA 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; use it to extend low half
  9037 000003CB F7F3                    		div	bx		; divide low half by 5
  9038 000003CD 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax		; cx:dx	is now number of ticks in time
  9039 000003CF CB                      		retf			; far return
  9040                                  
  9041                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9042                                  
  9043                                  ; 17/10/2022
  9044                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9045                                  
  9046                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  9047                                  ;
  9048                                  ; tim_writ sets the current time
  9049                                  ;
  9050                                  ; on entry es:[di] has the current time:
  9051                                  ;
  9052                                  ;	number of days since 1-1-80	(word)
  9053                                  ;	minutes (0-59)			(byte)
  9054                                  ;	hours (0-23)			(byte)
  9055                                  ;	hundredths of seconds (0-99)	(byte)
  9056                                  ;	seconds (0-59)			(byte)
  9057                                  ;
  9058                                  ; each number has been checked for the correct range.
  9059                                  ;
  9060                                  ;	NOTE: Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9061                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9062                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9063                                  ;
  9064                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  9065                                  
  9066                                  tim_writ:				; 2C7h:3DBh = 70h:294Bh
  9067 000003D0 268B05                  		mov	ax, [es:di]
  9068 000003D3 50                      		push	ax		; daycnt. we need to set this at the very
  9069                                  					; end to avoid tick windows.
  9070 000003D4 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9071                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9072 000003D9 7426                    		jz	short no_cmos_1
  9073 000003DB 268A4503                		mov	al, [es:di+3]	; near indirect	calls
  9074                                  					; get binary hours
  9075                                  					; convert to bcd
  9076 000003DF FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9077                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd	; call far [bintobcd]
  9078 000003E3 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch = bcd hours
  9079 000003E5 268A4502                		mov	al, [es:di+2]	; get binary minutes
  9080 000003E9 FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9081                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd	; convert to bcd
  9082 000003ED 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; cl = bcd minutes
  9083 000003EF 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; get binary seconds
  9084 000003F3 FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9085                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd
  9086 000003F7 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; dh = bcd seconds
  9087 000003F9 B200                    		mov	dl, 0		; dl = 0 (st) or 1 (dst)
  9088 000003FB FA                      		cli
  9089 000003FC B403                    		mov	ah, 3
  9090 000003FE CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9091                                  					; CH = hours in	BCD, CL	= minutes in BCD
  9092                                  					;  DH =	seconds	in BCD,DL = 01h	if daylight savings, 00h if standard time
  9093                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9094 00000400 FB                      		sti
  9095                                  no_cmos_1:				
  9096 00000401 268B4D02                		mov	cx, [es:di+2]
  9097 00000405 268B5504                		mov	dx, [es:di+4]
  9098                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9099 00000409 FF1E[E206]              		call	far [ttticks]
  9100                                  		;call	dword ptr ds:ttticks ; call far	[ttticks]
  9101                                  					; convert time to ticks
  9102                                  					; cx:dx	now has	time in	ticks
  9103 0000040D FA                      		cli			; turn off timer
  9104 0000040E B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  9105 00000410 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET TIME OF DAY
  9106                                  					; CX:DX	= clock	count
  9107                                  					; Return: time of day set
  9108                                  		;pop	ds:daycnt
  9109 00000412 8F06[F004]              		pop	word [daycnt]
  9110 00000416 FB                      		sti
  9111                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9112 00000417 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9113 0000041C 740A                    		jz	short no_cmos_2
  9114 0000041E FF1E[0605]              		call	far [daycnttoday]
  9115                                  		;call	ds:daycnttoday	; call far [daycnttoday]
  9116                                  					; convert to bcd format
  9117 00000422 FA                      		cli
  9118 00000423 B405                    		mov	ah, 5
  9119 00000425 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET DATE IN REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9120                                  					; DL = day in BCD, DH =	month in BCD, CL = year	in BCD
  9121                                  					; CH = century (19h or 20h)
  9122                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9123 00000427 FB                      		sti
  9124                                  no_cmos_2:
  9125                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9126                                  		; cf=0				
  9127                                  		;clc
  9128 00000428 C3                      		retn
  9129                                  
  9130                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9131                                  
  9132                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9133                                  
  9134                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9135                                  ; gettime reads date and time
  9136                                  ; and returns the following information:
  9137                                  ;
  9138                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
  9139                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
  9140                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
  9141                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
  9142                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
  9143                                  ;
  9144                                  ;	NOTE:  Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9145                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9146                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9147                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9148                                  
  9149                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
  9150 00000429 E84E00                  		call	GetTickCnt
  9151 0000042C 8B36[F004]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
  9152                                  
  9153                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
  9154                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
  9155                                  ;
  9156                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
  9157                                  ;	       ----------------
  9158                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
  9159                                  ;
  9160                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
  9161                                  ;
  9162                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
  9163                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9164                                  ;		1,193,180
  9165                                  ;
  9166                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
  9167                                  ;
  9168                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
  9169                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9170                                  ;		59,659
  9171                                  ;
  9172                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
  9173                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
  9174                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
  9175                                  ;
  9176                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
  9177                                  ; multiply by 5
  9178                                  
  9179 00000430 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
  9180 00000432 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
  9181                                  					; multiply by 5
  9182 00000434 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9183 00000436 D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
  9184 00000438 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9185 0000043A D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
  9186 0000043C 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
  9187 0000043E 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
  9188 00000440 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9189                                  
  9190                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
  9191                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
  9192                                  
  9193 00000441 B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
  9194 00000444 F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
  9195                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
  9196 00000446 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
  9197 00000448 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
  9198 0000044A F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
  9199                                  
  9200                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
  9201                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
  9202                                  
  9203 0000044C 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
  9204 0000044E B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		;extract 1/100's
  9205                                  
  9206                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
  9207                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
  9208                                  
  9209 00000451 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9210 00000453 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
  9211 00000456 7203                    		jb	short noadj
  9212 00000458 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
  9213                                  noadj:					
  9214 0000045B F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
  9215 0000045C 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
  9216                                  
  9217                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
  9218                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
  9219                                  
  9220 0000045E D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
  9221 00000460 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  9222 00000462 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
  9223 00000464 B93C00                  		mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
  9224 00000467 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9225 00000469 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
  9226 0000046B F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
  9227 0000046D 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
  9228                                  
  9229                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
  9230                                  
  9231 0000046F 50                      		push	ax
  9232 00000470 89F0                    		mov	ax, si		; daycnt
  9233 00000472 AB                      		stosw
  9234 00000473 58                      		pop	ax
  9235 00000474 AB                      		stosw
  9236 00000475 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  9237 00000477 AB                      		stosw
  9238 00000478 F8                      		clc
  9239 00000479 C3                      		retn
  9240                                  
  9241                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9242                                  
  9243                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9244                                  
  9245                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9246                                  ;
  9247                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
  9248                                  ;
  9249                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
  9250                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
  9251                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
  9252                                  ;
  9253                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
  9254                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
  9255                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
  9256                                  ;			else
  9257                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
  9258                                  ;		}
  9259                                  ;
  9260                                  ; USES : AX
  9261                                  ;
  9262                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
  9263                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
  9264                                  ;
  9265                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9266                                  
  9267                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9268                                  GetTickCnt:	
  9269 0000047A 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  9270 0000047C CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  9271                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  9272                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  9273                                  					; midnight
  9274                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  9275 0000047E 803E[F204]00            		cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
  9276 00000483 7507                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes  that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
  9277 00000485 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
  9278                                  					; and not flag
  9279 00000487 0106[F004]              		add	[daycnt], ax
  9280 0000048B C3                      		retn
  9281                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9282                                  
  9283                                  inc_case:				
  9284 0000048C 08C0                    		or	al, al
  9285 0000048E 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
  9286 00000490 FF06[F004]              		inc	word [daycnt]
  9287                                  no_rollover:				
  9288 00000494 C3                      		retn
  9289                                  
  9290                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9291                                  ; MSDISK.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
  9292                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9293                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9294                                  ; 09/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9295                                  
  9296                                  ; MSDISK.ASM - MSDOS 3.3 - 02/02/1988
  9297                                  ; 26/05/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  9298                                  ; 23/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
  9299                                  
  9300                                  ;error_unknown_media equ	7	; for use in BUILD BPB call
  9301                                  
  9302                                  ;struc BPB_TYPE
  9303                                  ;.SECSIZE:	resw 1
  9304                                  ;.SECALL:	resb 1
  9305                                  ;.RESNUM:	resw 1
  9306                                  ;.FATNUM:	resb 1
  9307                                  ;.DIRNUM:	resw 1
  9308                                  ;.SECNUM:	resw 1
  9309                                  ;.FATID:	resb 1
  9310                                  ;.FATSIZE:	resw 1
  9311                                  ;.SLIM:		resw 1
  9312                                  ;.HLIM:		resw 1
  9313                                  ;.HIDDEN:	resw 1
  9314                                  ;.size:
  9315                                  ;endstruc
  9316                                  
  9317                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9318                                  ;	disk interface routines
  9319                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9320                                  
  9321                                  ; device attribute bits:
  9322                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
  9323                                  
  9324                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
  9325                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
  9326                                  
  9327                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
  9328                                  
  9329                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
  9330                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
  9331                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
  9332                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
  9333                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
  9334                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
  9335                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
  9336                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
  9337                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
  9338                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
  9339                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
  9340                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
  9341                                  ; we reset the counter.
  9342                                  
  9343                                  accessmax	equ	5
  9344                                  
  9345                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
  9346                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
  9347                                  ;
  9348                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
  9349                                  ;   if it is 0, then
  9350                                  ;	set slow = 15
  9351                                  ;   else
  9352                                  ;	set slow = value
  9353                                  ;   ...
  9354                                  ;*********************************************
  9355                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
  9356                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
  9357                                  ;*	 use slow
  9358                                  ;*   else
  9359                                  ;*	 use fast
  9360                                  ;*********************************************
  9361                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
  9362                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
  9363                                  ;	use slow
  9364                                  ;   else
  9365                                  ;	use fast
  9366                                  ;   ...
  9367                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  9368                                  ;
  9369                                  ;
  9370                                  ;---------------------------------------
  9371                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
  9372                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
  9373                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
  9374                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
  9375                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
  9376

  9455                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9456                                  
  9457                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9458                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
  9459                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
  9460                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]
  9461                                  ;
  9462                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.
  9463                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9464                                  
  9465                                  SetDrive:	
  9466                                  		;les	di, ds:start_bds ; Point es:di to first bds	
  9467 000004CB C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; 19/10/2022
  9468                                  X_Scan_Loop:				
  9469 000004CF 26384505                		cmp	[es:di+5], al	
  9470 000004D3 7409                    		jz	short X_SetDrv
  9471 000004D5 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link] ; Go	to next	bds
  9472 000004D8 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
  9473 000004DB 75F2                    		jnz	short X_Scan_Loop
  9474 000004DD F9                      		stc
  9475                                  X_SetDrv:				
  9476 000004DE C3                      		retn
  9477                                  
  9478                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9479                                  
  9480                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9481                                  
  9482                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9483                                  ; if id is f9, have a 96tpi disk else
  9484                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed
  9485                                  ;  otherwise if within 2 secs of last disk operation media could not
  9486                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed
  9487                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9488                                  
  9489                                  media_chk:				; 2C7h:4EBh = 70h:2A5Bh
  9490 000004DF E8E9FF                  		call	SetDrive
  9491 000004E2 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1
  9492 000004E5 26F6452401              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
  9493                                  					; fchanged_by_format
  9494 000004EA 7416                    		jz	short WeAreNotFakingIt
  9495                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9496 000004EC 26806524FE              		and	byte [es:di+24h], 0FEh ; ~fchanged_by_format
  9497                                  		;and	word [es:di+23h], 0FEFFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
  9498                                  					; ~fchanged_by_format ;	reset flag
  9499 000004F1 C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh ; -1
  9500                                  					; Ensure that we ask the rom if media has changed
  9501 000004F6 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
  9502                                  					; fnon_removable
  9503 000004FB 740C                    		jz	short wehaveafloppy
  9504 000004FD BEFFFF                  		mov	si, 0FFFFh	; Indicate media changed
  9505 00000500 EB2C                    		jmp	short Media_Done ; Media_Done
  9506                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9507                                  
  9508                                  WeAreNotFakingIt:
  9509                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], fnon_removable			
  9510 00000502 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
  9511 00000507 7525                    		jnz	short Media_Done
  9512                                  wehaveafloppy:				
  9513 00000509 31F6                    		xor	si, si		; Presume "I don't know"
  9514                                  
  9515                                  		; If we have a floppy with changeline support, we ask the ROM
  9516                                  		; to determine if media has changed. We do not perform the
  9517                                  		; 2 second check for these drives.
  9518                                  
  9519 0000050B 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; Do we	have changeline	support?
  9520 00000510 740A                    		jz	short mChk_NoChangeLine	; Brif not
  9521 00000512 E87912                  		call	mediacheck	;  Call	into removable routine
  9522 00000515 7236                    		jb	short err_exitj
  9523 00000517 E8C913                  		call	haschange
  9524 0000051A 7512                    		jnz	short Media_Done
  9525                                  mChk_NoChangeLine:
  9526                                  		; If we come here, we have a floppy with no changeline support
  9527                                  			
  9528 0000051C BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; Presume no change
  9529 0000051F A0[1E01]                		mov	al, [tim_drv]	; Last drive accessed
  9530 00000522 263A4504                		cmp	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
  9531                                  					; Is drive of last access the same?
  9532 00000526 7505                    		jnz	short Media_Unk	; No, then "i don't know"
  9533 00000528 E82800                  		call	Check_Time_Of_Access

  9541                                  		; Clean up the left overs
  9542                                  Media_Done:

  9547 00000537 07                      		pop	es
  9548 00000538 09F6                    		or	si, si

  9563                                  ret81:

  9565 00000552 C3                      		retn			; return with carry set
  9566                                  
  9567                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9568                                  
  9569                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9570                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
  9571                                  ; drive.
  9572                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
  9573                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
  9574                                  ; returns in si:
  9575                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
  9576                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
  9577                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
  9578                                  ;
  9579                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
  9580                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9581                                  
  9582                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9583                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
  9584 00000553 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
  9585 00000556 E821FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
  9586 00000559 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
  9587                                  					; get stored time
  9588 0000055D 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
  9589 0000055F 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
  9590 00000563 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
  9591 00000565 751A                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
  9592 00000567 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
  9593 00000569 7511                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
  9594 0000056B FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
  9595 0000056F 803E[1D01]05            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
  9596                                  					; if count is less than threshold, ok
  9597 00000574 720C                    		jb	short timecheck_ret
  9598 00000576 FE0E[1D01]              		dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
  9599 0000057A EB05                    		jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
  9600                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9601                                  
  9602                                  timepassed:				
  9603 0000057C 83FA24                  		cmp	dx, 36		; 18*2 ; 18.2 tics per second.
  9604                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
  9605 0000057F 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
  9606                                  
  9607                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.
  9608                                  timecheck_unk:				
  9609 00000581 4E                      		dec	si		; presume i don't know
  9610                                  timecheck_ret:				
  9611 00000582 C3                      		retn
  9612                                  
  9613                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

  9626                                  		; 19/10/2022

  9641 0000059D 72B1                    		jb	short ret81
  9642                                  		;cmp	ds:set_id_flag,	2 ; already, volume_label set from boot
  9643 0000059F 803E[0A05]02            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 2
  9644                                  		;mov	ds:set_id_flag,	0 ; record to bds table?
  9645 000005A4 C606[0A05]00            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 0

  9662                                  ; ==========================================================================
  9663                                  ;Setptrsav is also jumped to from dsk_init (msbio2.asm). In both cases, the
  9664                                  ;pointer to be returned is in es:di. We were incorrectly returning ds:di.
  9665                                  ;Note that this works in most cases because most pointers are in Bios_Data.
  9666                                  ;It fails, for instance, when we install an external drive using driver.sys
  9667                                  ;because then the BDS segment is no longer Bios_Data.

  9669                                  ;this returns to Chardev_entry (msbio1.asm) where all registers are 
  9670                                  ;restored before returning to the caller.

  9688                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
  9689                                  ; clear ids in bds table. only applied for floppies.
  9690                                  ;input:  es:di -> bds table
  9691                                  ;	assumes ds: -> Bios_Data
  9692                                  ;output: volid set to "NO NAME    "
  9693                                  ;	 vol_serial set to 0.
  9694                                  ;	 filesys_id set to "FAT12   " or "FAT16   "
  9695                                  ;	   depending on the flag fatsize in bds.
  9696                                  ;
  9697                                  ;	trashes si, cx
  9698                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
  9699                                  
  9700                                  ;size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL equ 11
  9701                                  ;size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID equ 8
  9702                                  
  9703                                  clear_ids:
  9704                                  		; 11/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.1 IO.SYS (Optimization & BugFix)
  9705 000005CC 268A451F                		mov	al, [es:di+1Fh] ; mov al,[es:di+BDS.fatsiz]
  9706                                  clear_ids_x:	; 11/09/2023		
  9707                                   		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05D9h)
  9708 000005D0 57                      		push	di

  9710 000005D3 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
  9711 000005D7 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
  9712                                  
  9713                                  		; BUGBUG - there's a lot in common here and with
  9714                                  		; mov_media_ids.. see if we can save some space by
  9715                                  		; merging them... jgl
  9716                                  
  9717                                  		;mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
  9718                                  		; 10/12/2022

  9720                                  
  9721                                  		;mov	si, offset vol_no_name ; "NO NAME    "
  9722 000005DD BE[1D05]                		mov	si, vol_no_name	; 19/10/2022
  9723 000005E0 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
  9724 000005E3 F3A4                    		rep movsb
  9725                                  		
  9726                                  		; 11/09/2023 (BugFix, DI is not start addr of BDS structure here)
  9727                                  		;;test	byte [es:di+BDS.fatsiz], fbig
  9728                                  		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05EFh)
  9729                                  		;test	byte [es:di+1Fh], 40h
  9730                                  
  9731                                  			; ! NOTE - 11/08/2023 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS bugfix)
  9732                                  			; Microsoft/IBM code has a bug here because the BDS's
  9733                                  			; .volid and .filesys_id fields will be reset
  9734                                  			; (to their default text) according to 'BDS.fatsiz' flags
  9735                                  			; at the BDS offset 31 but current (this) code checks flags
  9736                                  			; at ES:DI+31 while DI points the BDS offset 86!?
  9737                                  			;
  9738                                  			; Correct Code:
  9739                                  			; ;test byte [ES:31],40h or [ES:BDS.fatsiz],fbig
  9740                                  			; 11/09/2023
  9741                                  			; (before 'rep movsb') 'mov al,[es:di+BDS.Fatsiz]' and then
  9742                                  			; (after 'rep movsb') 'test al,fbig' (AL is free/proper to use here)	
  9743                                  			;
  9744                                  			; Same BUG is existing in PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:06C3h
  9745                                  			; and in Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0E1Ah as 'test byte [es:di+59],20h'
  9746                                  			; (PCDOS 7.1 BUG note: 26/06/2023)
  9747                                  			;
  9748                                  			; (Why this bug did not affect MSDOS and PCDOS 7.x applications:
  9749                                  			; 'clear_ids' is used for floppy disks only and the default
  9750                                  			; option of 'clear_ids' is FAT12 volid and filesys_id text
  9751                                  			; when the flag bit has wrong value for FAT16/40h or FAT32/20h.)
  9752                                  
  9753 000005E5 A840                    		test	al, 40h ; * 
  9754                                  		
  9755                                  		;mov	si, offset fat_16_id ; "FAT16	"
  9756 000005E7 BE[1405]                		mov	si, fat_16_id	; 19/10/2022
  9757 000005EA 7503                    		jnz	short ci_bigfat
  9758                                  		;mov	si, offset fat_12_id ; "FAT12	"
  9759 000005EC BE[0B05]                		mov	si, fat_12_id	 ; 19/10/2022
  9760                                  ci_bigfat:				
  9761                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
  9762                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9763 000005EF B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8 
  9764 000005F1 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
  9765                                  					; filesys_id field

  9773                                  
  9774                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9775                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
  9776                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
  9777                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
  9778                                  ;	    for all other cases,
  9779                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
  9780                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
  9781                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
  9782                                  ;
  9783                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
  9784                                  ;
  9785                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
  9786                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
  9787                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
  9788                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
  9789                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
  9790                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
  9791                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
  9792                                  ;
  9793                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
  9794                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
  9795                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
  9796                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9797                                  
  9798                                  GetBp:		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.
