 13733 000014AF 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13734                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13735                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13736 000014B3 07                      		pop	es
 13737 000014B4 5B                      		pop	bx
 13738 000014B5 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13739                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13740                                  
 13741                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13742                                  
 13743                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13744                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13745                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13746                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13747                                  
 13748                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13749 000014B7 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13750                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13751 000014BC 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 13752 000014BE 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 13753                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13754 000014C3 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13755                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 13756 000014C5 50                      		push	ax
 13757 000014C6 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 13758                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 13759                                  		; 17/10/2022

 13761                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 13762                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13763 000014CD 58                      		pop	ax
 13764 000014CE EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13765                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13766                                  
 13767                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13768                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13769                                  
 13770                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 13771                                  
 13772                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 13773                                  
 13774                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 13775                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 13776                                  
 13777                                  		; 19/10/2022

 13779                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 13780                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data

 13782                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13783                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13784                                  
 13785                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 13786

 13788 000014D9 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat

 13790                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 13791                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 13792 000014DE 803E[3105]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?

 13794                                  					; go handle it out of line if so

 13796                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 13797 000014E5 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13798                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13799                                  		
 13800 000014EA 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 13801

 13803                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 13804 000014F0 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 13805                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 13806                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 13807 000014F2 9D                      		popf
 13808 000014F3 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 13809                                  ret_from_i13:				
 13810 000014F5 1F                      		pop	ds
 13811 000014F6 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 13812                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13813                                  
 13814                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 13815                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 13816                                  ; a changeline error.
 13817                                  
 13818                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 13819 000014F9 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 13820                                  i13_ret_error:				
 13821 000014FB 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 13822 000014FE 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 13823 00001500 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 13824 00001502 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 13825 00001504 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 13826 00001509 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 13827                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 13828                                  					; never	would
 13829 0000150B 53                      		push	bx
 13830 0000150C BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 13831 0000150F E8AA03                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13832 00001512 5B                      		pop	bx
 13833                                  int13b:					
 13834 00001513 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 13835 00001514 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 13836                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13837                                  
 13838                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 13839                                  
 13840                                  goterr13:				
 13841 00001516 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 13842 00001519 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 13843                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 13844 0000151B 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 13845 0000151E 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 13846 00001520 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 13847 00001525 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 13848                                  
 13849 00001527 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 13850                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 13851                                  					; (2 = romread)
 13852                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 13853 0000152C 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 13854                                  
 13855 0000152E 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13856                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 13857                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13858 00001530 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13859                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13860                                  					; call far 70:797h
 13861 00001535 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 13862 00001538 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 13863 0000153A 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 13864 0000153C 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 13865 0000153E 53                      		push	bx
 13866 0000153F 51                      		push	cx
 13867 00001540 52                      		push	dx
 13868 00001541 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 13869                                  loop_ecc:				
 13870 00001544 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13871                                  
 13872                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 13873                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 13874                                  ;
 13875                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 13876                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 13877                                  ; track.
 13878                                  ;
 13879                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 13880                                  ; this request.
 13881                                  ;
 13882                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 13883                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 13884                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 13885                                  ;
 13886 00001547 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 13887                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 13888                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13889 0000154A 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13890                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13891 0000154F 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 13892 00001551 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 13893 00001554 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 13894 00001556 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 13895 00001559 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 13896                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13897                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 13898                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 13899 0000155B 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 13900                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 13901                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 13902                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 13903                                  ok11_op:				
 13904 0000155D FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 13905 00001561 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 13906 00001563 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 13907                                  					; add 200h to address
 13908 00001565 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13909 00001567 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13910 00001569 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 13911                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13912                                  
 13913                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 13914                                  
 13915                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 13916 0000156B F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 13917                                  ok11_exit:				
 13918 0000156C 5A                      		pop	dx
 13919 0000156D 59                      		pop	cx
 13920 0000156E 5B                      		pop	bx
 13921 0000156F EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13922                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13923                                  
 13924                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 13925                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 13926                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 13927                                  
 13928                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 13929 00001571 06                      		push	es
 13930 00001572 53                      		push	bx
 13931 00001573 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13932 00001576 1E                      		push	ds
 13933 00001577 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 13934 00001578 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13935                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 13936                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13937 0000157B 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13938                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13939 00001580 5B                      		pop	bx
 13940 00001581 07                      		pop	es
 13941 00001582 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 13942 00001584 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 13943 00001587 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 13944                                  
 13945                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 13946                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 13947                                  
 13948                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 13949 00001589 56                      		push	si
 13950 0000158A 57                      		push	di
 13951 0000158B 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13952 0000158D BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13953 00001590 E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 13954 00001593 5F                      		pop	di
 13955 00001594 5E                      		pop	si
 13956 00001595 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 13957                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13958                                  
 13959                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 13960                                  ; operation as best we can.
 13961                                  
 13962                                  gotdmaerr:				
 13963 00001597 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 13964 0000159A FB                      		sti
 13965 0000159B 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 13966 0000159E 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13967                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 13968                                  					; functions we don't handle
 13969 000015A0 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 13970 000015A3 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 13971 000015A5 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13972 000015A8 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 13973 000015AA 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13974                                  
 13975                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 13976                                  
 13977                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 13978                                  
 13979 000015AC 52                      		push	dx
 13980 000015AD 51                      		push	cx
 13981 000015AE 53                      		push	bx
 13982 000015AF 50                      		push	ax
 13983 000015B0 55                      		push	bp
 13984 000015B1 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 13985 000015B3 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 13986 000015B5 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13987 000015B7 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13988 000015B9 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13989 000015BB D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 13990 000015BD 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 13991 000015BF 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 13992                                  
 13993                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 13994                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 13995                                  
 13996 000015C3 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 13997 000015C5 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 13998                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13999                                  
 14000                                  no_skip_first:				
 14001 000015C8 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 14002 000015CA B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 14003 000015CC 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 14004                                  
 14005                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 14006                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 14007                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 14008                                  ;
 14009                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 14010                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 14011                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 14012                                  ; in error.
 14013                                  
 14014 000015CE 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 14015 000015D0 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 14016                                  
 14017                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 14018                                  
 14019 000015D2 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14020                                  					; set up head number
 14021 000015D5 E888FE                  		call	doint
 14022 000015D8 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 14023                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14024                                  
 14025                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 14026 000015DB B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 14027 000015DD F9                      		stc
 14028 000015DE E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 14029                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 14030                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14031                                  
 14032                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 14033                                  
 14034                                  intverify:				
 14035 000015E1 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 14036 000015E2 53                      		push	bx
 14037 000015E3 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14038 000015E4 07                      		pop	es
 14039                                  dosimple:				
 14040 000015E5 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14041                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14042                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14043                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14044 000015E8 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14045                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14046 000015ED 5B                      		pop	bx
 14047 000015EE 07                      		pop	es
 14048 000015EF E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14049                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14050                                  
 14051                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14052                                  
 14053                                  intformat:				
 14054 000015F2 06                      		push	es
 14055 000015F3 53                      		push	bx
 14056 000015F4 56                      		push	si
 14057 000015F5 57                      		push	di
 14058 000015F6 1E                      		push	ds
 14059                                  
 14060                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14061                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14062                                  
 14063 000015F7 06                      		push	es
 14064 000015F8 1E                      		push	ds
 14065 000015F9 07                      		pop	es
 14066 000015FA 1F                      		pop	ds
 14067 000015FB 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14068 000015FD BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14069 00001600 E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14070 00001603 1F                      		pop	ds
 14071 00001604 5F                      		pop	di
 14072 00001605 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14073 00001606 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14074                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14075                                  
 14076                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14077                                  ; the first block.
 14078                                  ;
 14079                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14080                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14081                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14082                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14083                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14084                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14085                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14086                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14087                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14088                                  
 14089                                  doblock:
 14090                                  
 14091                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14092                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14093                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14094                                  				
 14095 00001608 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14096                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14097 0000160B 51                      		push	cx
 14098 0000160C 06                      		push	es
 14099 0000160D 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14100                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14101 0000160E E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14102 00001611 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14103                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14104 00001615 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14105                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14106 0000161A 5F                      		pop	di
 14107 0000161B 07                      		pop	es
 14108 0000161C 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14109 0000161E 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14110 00001620 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14111 00001622 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14112                                  doblockflop:				
 14113 00001624 59                      		pop	cx
 14114                                  doblockcontinue:			
 14115 00001625 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14116 00001627 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14117 00001629 50                      		push	ax
 14118 0000162A 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14119 0000162C EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14120                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14121                                  
 14122                                  doblocklast:				
 14123 0000162E 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14124 00001630 50                      		push	ax
 14125                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 14126 00001631 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14127 00001634 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14128 00001636 58                      		pop	ax
 14129 00001637 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14130                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14131 0000163A 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14132 0000163C 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14133 0000163E 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14134 00001640 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14135 00001642 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14136                                  					; then we are done already.
 14137 00001644 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14138                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14139 00001646 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14140 00001649 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14141                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14142                                  
 14143                                  bufferx:				
 14144 0000164B 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14145                                  					; set up head number
 14146                                  buffer:					
 14147 0000164E 53                      		push	bx
 14148 0000164F 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14149 00001652 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14150 00001655 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14151                                  					
 14152                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14153                                  
 14154 00001657 06                      		push	es
 14155 00001658 1E                      		push	ds
 14156 00001659 56                      		push	si
 14157 0000165A 57                      		push	di
 14158 0000165B 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14159 0000165C 06                      		push	es
 14160 0000165D 1F                      		pop	ds
 14161 0000165E 07                      		pop	es
 14162 0000165F BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14163 00001662 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14164 00001663 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14165 00001665 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14166 00001668 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14167                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14168 00001669 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14169 0000166A 5E                      		pop	si
 14170 0000166B 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14171                                  
 14172                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14173                                  
 14174 0000166C B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14175                                  					; get drive number
 14176 0000166E 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14177 00001671 E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14178                                  					;
 14179                                  					; ah is	function
 14180                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14181                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14182                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14183                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14184                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14185 00001674 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14186 00001677 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14187 00001678 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14188 0000167A EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14189                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14190                                  
 14191                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14192                                  
 14193                                  doread:					
 14194 0000167C 06                      		push	es
 14195 0000167D 53                      		push	bx
 14196 0000167E 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14197 0000167F 07                      		pop	es
 14198 00001680 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14199 00001683 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14200 00001685 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14201                                  					; get drive number
 14202 00001688 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14203                                  					; ah = function
 14204                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14205                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14206                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14207 0000168B E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14208 0000168E 5B                      		pop	bx
 14209 0000168F 07                      		pop	es
 14210 00001690 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14211 00001692 56                      		push	si
 14212 00001693 57                      		push	di
 14213 00001694 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14214 00001696 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14215 00001699 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 14216 0000169C 5F                      		pop	di
 14217 0000169D 5E                      		pop	si
 14218                                  
 14219                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14220                                  
 14221                                  dotail:					
 14222 0000169E 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14223 0000169F 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14224 000016A2 41                      		inc	cx
 14225 000016A3 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14226 000016A6 F8                      		clc
 14227 000016A7 FEC8                    		dec	al
 14228 000016A9 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14229                                  
 14230                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14231                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14232                                  
 14233 000016AB 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14234 000016AE E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14235 000016B1 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14236                                  
 14237                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14238                                  
 14239                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14240                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14241                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14242                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14243                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14244                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14245                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14246                                  
 14247                                  bad13:					
 14248 000016B4 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14249 000016B6 5D                      		pop	bp
 14250 000016B7 5B                      		pop	bx
 14251 000016B8 5B                      		pop	bx
 14252 000016B9 59                      		pop	cx
 14253 000016BA 5A                      		pop	dx
 14254 000016BB 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14255 000016BD E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14256                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14257                                  
 14258                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 14259 000016C0 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14260                                  
 14261                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14262                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14263                                  		;db 	0
 14264                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14265                                  
 14266                                  ;Bios_Code ends

 14283                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14284                                  
 14285                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14286                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14287                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14288                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14289                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14290                                  
 14291                                  install_bds:		
 14292 000016CF 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14293 000016D0 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14294                                  
 14295                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14296                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14297                                  loop_next_bds:				
 14298 000016D3 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14299                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14300 000016D5 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14301 000016D9 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14302                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14303 000016DC 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14304 000016DE B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14305 000016E0 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14306                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14307 000016E4 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14308 000016E7 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14309                                  					; we don't own it
 14310 000016EC 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14311                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14312 000016EF 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14313 000016F2 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14314                                  next_bds:				
 14315                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 14316 000016F6 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 14317 000016F9 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14318                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14319                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14320 000016FB 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14321 000016FD 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14322                                  					; install bds
 14323 00001700 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14324 00001702 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14325                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14326                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14327 00001705 1F                      		pop	ds
 14328                                  
 14329                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 14330                                  ;
 14331                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 14332                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 14333                                  ;
 14334                                  ;		; 01/06/2019
 14335                                  ;		;mov	al,[es:di+52]
 14336                                  ;		mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 14337                                  ;
 14338                                  ;		cmp	al,[eot]
 14339                                  ;		jbe	short _eot_ok
 14340                                  ;		mov	[eot],al
 14341                                  
 14342 00001706 C3                      		retn

 14433                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------
