 19049                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19050                                  ;
 19051                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 19052                                  ;
 19053                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.
 19054                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 19055                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 19056                                  ;
 19057                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow
 19058                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 19059                                  ; 
 19060                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19061                                  
 19062                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19063                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:092Ah)
 19064                                  TryToMovDOSHi:
 19065                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19066                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19067                                  	; ds = cs
 19068 000008DA E81300                  	call	MovDOSHi
 19069 000008DD 7210                    	jc	short ttldhx
 19070                                  
 19071                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 19072                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19073                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION] ; give dos its temporary loc.
 19074                                  	;;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION] ; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19075                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19076                                  	; ds = cs
 19077 000008DF 8E06[7102]              	mov	es,[CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION]
 19078                                  ;else
 19079                                  ;	..
 19080                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 19081                                  
 19082                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19083                                  	; ds = cs
 19084 000008E3 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; ax = 00 ---> install stub
 19085                                  	;call	far [cs:dos_segreinit]	; call dos segreinit
 19086 000008E5 FF1E[7B02]              	call	far [dos_segreinit]
 19087                                  	;mov	byte [cs:runhigh],1
 19088 000008E9 C606[6A02]01            	mov	byte [runhigh],1
 19089 000008EE F8                      	clc
 19090                                  ttldhx:
 19091 000008EF C3                      	retn
 19092                                  
 19093                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19094                                  ;
 19095                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 19096                                  ;
 19097                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 19098                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 19099                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 19100                                  ;
 19101                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed
 19102                                  ;
 19103                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19104                                  
 19105                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19106                                  MovDOSHi:
 19107                                  	; 14/05/2019
 19108                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19109                                  	; ds = cs
 19110 000008F0 E8D600                  	call	AllocHMA
 19111 000008F3 7213                    	jc	short mdhx			; did we get HMA?
 19112 000008F5 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh			; yes, HMA seg = 0ffffh
 19113 000008F8 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19114                                  
 19115                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 19116                                  	; actually move the BIOS and DOS
 19117                                  
 19118                                  	; NOTE: Retro DOS v4.0 does not move BIOS (IO.SYS) to HMA
 19119                                  	; 24/03/2019
 19120                                  	
 19121                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19122 000008FA E83200                  	call	MovBIOS				; First move BIOS into HMA
 19123                                  
 19124                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after BIOS
 19125                                  	
 19126                                  	; 14/05/2019
 19127                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19128                                  	;xor	di,di
 19129                                  	
 19130                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19131                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:hi_doscod_size]		; pass the code size of DOS
 19132                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19133                                  	; ds = cs
 19134 000008FD 8B0E[8102]              	mov	cx,[hi_doscod_size]		; when it is in HMA
 19135 00000901 E81100                  	call	MovDOS				; and move it
 19136                                  
 19137                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after DOS
 19138                                  ;else
 19139                                  ;	; allocate space at beginning of HMA to allow for CPMHack
 19140                                  ;
 19141                                  ;	mov	di,0E0h				; room for 5 bytes at ffff:d0
 19142                                  ;
 19143                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 19144                                  
 19145 00000904 E85E02                  	call	SaveFreeHMAPtr			; Save the Free HMA ptr
 19146 00000907 F8                      	clc
 19147                                  mdhx:
 19148 00000908 C3                      	retn

 19284                                  ;
 19285                                  ;		Moves BIOS code into requested segment
 19286                                  ;

 19288                                  ;		  ( it moves always into offset BCode_Start)

 19291                                  ;

 19309 0000093D 29F1                    	sub	cx,si				; size of BIOS
 19310 0000093F D1E9                    	shr	cx,1				; Both the labels are para
 19311                                  						;  aligned

 19313                                  	
 19314                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19315 00000943 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs

 19319 00000946 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 19320                                  	;
 19321                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19322                                  	;mov	[cs:BCodeSeg],ax		; save it for later use
 19323                                  	;;call	dword ptr cs:_seg_reinit_ptr
 19324                                  	;call	far [cs:seg_reinit_ptr]		; far call to seg_reinit (M022)
 19325                                  	; ds = cs

 19328                                  	;
 19329 0000094F 5F                      	pop	di
 19330 00000950 07                      	pop	es				; get back end of BIOS
 19331 00000951 C3                      	retn

 19474                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 19475                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 19476                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 19477                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 19478                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 19479                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 19480                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 19481                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 19482                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 19483                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 19484                                  ;	  stub will go.
 19485                                  ;
 19486                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 19487                                  
 19488                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19489                                  update_arena:
 19490 00000982 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 19491 00000983 57                      	push	di
 19492 00000984 51                      	push	cx
 19493 00000985 52                      	push	dx
 19494                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19495                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 19496                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19497                                  	; ds = cs 
 19498 00000986 C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 19499 0000098A 4F                      	dec	di
 19500 0000098B 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 19501                                  						;  before sysvar
 19502 0000098C 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 19503                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 19504 0000098E 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 19505 00000993 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 19506 00000995 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 19507                                  
 19508                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 19509 00000997 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 19510 0000099C 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 19511 0000099E 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 19512 000009A0 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 19513 000009A2 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19514                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 19515 000009A4 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 19516                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 19517 000009A8 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 19518 000009AE 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 19519                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 19520 000009B0 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 19521 000009B4 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 19522                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19523                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 19524 000009B6 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 19525 000009B9 5A                      	pop	dx
 19526 000009BA 59                      	pop	cx
 19527 000009BB 5F                      	pop	di
 19528 000009BC 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 19529 000009BD C3                      	retn
 19530                                  ;
 19531                                  ; M012 : END
 19532                                  ;

 19552                                  ;
 19553                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19554                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19555                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19556                                  ;
 19557                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success

 19563                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 19564                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 19565                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low

 19719                                  
 19720                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19721                                  ;
 19722                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19723                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19724                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19725                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19726                                  ;
 19727                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19728                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19729                                  ;
 19730                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19731                                  
 19732                                  StartVDHead:
 19733                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19734                                  
 19735 00000A41 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19736 00000A45 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19737 00000A47 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19738 00000A49 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19739 00000A4B 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19740                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19741 00000A4C 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19742                                  VDiskSig1:
 19743 00000A53 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19744                                  
 19745                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19746                                  
 19747 00000A58 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19748                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19749 00000A5E 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19750 00000A6D 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19751 00000A6F 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 19752                                  VDInt19:
 19753 00000A70 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 19754                                  OldVDInt19:
 19755 00000A71 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 19756                                  
 19757                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 19758                                  
 19759                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 19760 00000A75 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 19761                                  VDiskSig2:
 19762 00000A78 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19763                                  
 19764                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 19765                                  
 19766 00000A7D 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 19767 00000A80 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 19768 00000A82 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 19769 00000A83 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 19770 00000A85 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 19771 00000A86 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 19772 00000A88 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 19773 00000A8A FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 19774 00000A8B 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 19775 00000A8D 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 19776 00000A8F 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 19777 00000A91 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 19778 00000A93 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 19779                                  
 19780                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 19781                                  
 19782                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19783                                  ;
 19784                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 19785                                  ;
 19786                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 19787                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 19788                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 19789                                  ;
 19790                                  ; Inputs : None
 19791                                  ;
 19792                                  ; Outputs : None
 19793                                  ;
 19794                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 19795                                  ;
 19796                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19797                                  
 19798                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19799                                  
 19800                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 19801 00000A95 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 19802 00000A97 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 19803                                  
 19804                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 19805                                  
 19806                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19807 00000A99 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 19808                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 19809 00000A9C 2EA3[710A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 19810 00000AA0 A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 19811                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19812 00000AA3 2EA3[730A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19813                                  
 19814                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 19815                                  
 19816 00000AA7 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 19817                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 19818                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19819 00000AA9 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 19820 00000AAC CD21                    	int	21h
 19821                                  
 19822                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 19823                                  
 19824 00000AAE 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 19825 00000AAF 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19826                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 19827 00000AB1 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 19828                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 19829 00000AB8 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 19830 00000ABF 40                      	inc	ax
 19831 00000AC0 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 19832                                  
 19833                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 19834                                  
 19835 00000AC2 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 19836                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 19837 00000AC3 C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 19838 00000AC9 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 19839                                  
 19840                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 19841                                  
 19842                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 19843 00000ACC B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 19844 00000ACF BE[410A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 19845 00000AD2 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 19846 00000AD4 0E                      	push	cs
 19847 00000AD5 1F                      	pop	ds
 19848 00000AD6 FC                      	cld
 19849 00000AD7 F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 19850 00000AD9 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 19851                                  
 19852                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 19853                                  
 19854                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19855 00000ADA 57                      	push	di
 19856 00000ADB 06                      	push	es
 19857                                  
 19858                                  	;mov	ax,0FFFFh
 19859                                  	;mov	es,ax
 19860                                  	; 04/09/2023
 19861 00000ADC 49                      	dec	cx
 19862                                  	; cx = 0FFFFh
 19863 00000ADD 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 19864                                  
 19865 00000ADF BF1000                  	mov	di,10h

 19870

 19872 00000AEB 07                      	pop	es
 19873                                  
 19874 00000AEC C3                      	retn
 19875                                  
 19876                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19877                                  ; procedure : ClrVDISKHeader
 19878                                  ;
 19879                                  ;		Clears the first 32 bytes at 1MB boundary
 19880                                  ;		So that DOS/HIMEM is not confused about the VDISK header
 19881                                  ;		left by previous DOS=HIGH session

 19920                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIt1.ASM)
 19921                                  
 19922                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 19923                                  
 19924                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19925                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 19926                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 19927                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 19928                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 19929                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 19930                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 19931                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 19932                                  ;								      ;I070
 19933                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 19934                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 19935                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 19936                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 19937                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 19938                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 19939                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 19940                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 19941                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 19942                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 19943                                  ;								      ;I070
 19944                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 19945                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19946                                  
 19947                                  	; 12/12/2022
 19948                                  	; ds = cs
 19949                                  
 19950 00000B3D 06                      	push	es
 19951 00000B3E 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 19952 00000B40 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 19953 00000B42 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 19954 00000B44 D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 19955 00000B46 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 19956 00000B48 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 19957 00000B4A 05[1D0B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 19958 00000B4D 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 19959                                  
 19960                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 19961                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 19962                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax
 19963                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 19964                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+4],dl

 19969 00000B53 8816[010B]              	mov	[src_desc+4],dl

 19972 00000B5A 0E                      	push	cs

 19990                                  ;		the offset.

 20069                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 20070                                  ;
 20071                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 20072                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 20073                                  ;
 20074                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20075                                  
 20076                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20077                                  CPMHack:

 20079 00000BAF B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 20080 00000BB2 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = FFFF
 20081                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 20082                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20083 00000BB4 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 20084 00000BB5 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 20085 00000BB7 BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 20086 00000BBA BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 20087                                  	;mov	cx,5
 20088 00000BBD B105                    	mov	cl,5
 20089 00000BBF FC                      	cld
 20090 00000BC0 F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 20091 00000BC2 1F                      	pop	ds
 20092 00000BC3 C3                      	retn

 20975                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 20976                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 20977                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 20978                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 20979                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 20980                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 20981                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 20982                                  ;
 20983                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 20984                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 20985                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 20986                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 20987                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 20988                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 20989                                  ;
 20990                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 20991                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 20992                                  ;
 20993                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 20994                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 20995                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 20996                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 20997                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 20998                                  ;
 20999                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21000                                  ;
 21001                                  ;			  none.
 21002                                  
 21003                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21004                                  ;
 21005                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21006                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21007                                  
 21008                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21009

 21209                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21210                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21211                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 21212                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21213                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 21214                                  ;
 21215                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 21216                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 21217                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 21218                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 21219                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 21220                                  ; program).
 21221                                  
 21222                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 21223                                  
 21224                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 21225                                  
 21226 0000102C 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 21227                                  
 21228                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 21229                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 21230                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 21231                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 21232                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 21233                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 21234                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 21235                                  ; carridge return.
 21236                                  
 21237                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 21238                                  ;character after =.
 21239                                  
 21240 0000102D 06                      	push	es
 21241 0000102E 1E                      	push	ds
 21242 0000102F 07                      	pop	es
 21243 00001030 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 21244 00001031 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 21245                                  
 21246 00001033 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21247 00001035 FC                      	cld
 21248 00001036 2EC606[6D03]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 21249 0000103C BF[6E03]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 21250                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 21251 0000103F AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 21252 00001040 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 21253 00001042 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 21254 00001044 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 21255                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 21256 00001046 AC                      	lodsb
 21257 00001047 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 21258 0000104A 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 21259 0000104C 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 21260 0000104E FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 21261 00001050 47                      	inc	di
 21262 00001051 EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 21263                                  done_installparm:
 21264 00001053 2E880E[6C03]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 21265 00001058 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 21266 0000105B 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 21267 0000105D 2EC606[6D03]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 21268                                  					; starts with cr.
 21269                                  install_seg_set:
 21270 00001063 2EC70600000000          	mov	word [cs:0],0		; make a null environment segment
 21271 0000106A 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs			; by overlap jmp instruction of sysinitseg.
 21272                                  
 21273                                  ;---------------------------------------------------M067----------------
 21274                                  ;
 21275                                  ; 	the environment pointer is made 0. so the current environment ptr.
 21276                                  ; 	will be the same as pdb_environ which after dosinit is 0.
 21277                                  ;
 21278                                  ; 	mov	cs:[instexe.exec0_environ],0 ; set the environment seg.
 21279                                  ;
 21280                                  ; 	instexe.exec0_environ need not be initialized to 0 above. It was
 21281                                  ; 	done as a fix for bug #529. The actual bug was in NLSFUNC and
 21282                                  ; 	was fixed. 
 21283                                  ;
 21284                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21285

 21289

 21295                                  ;no_envdata2:

 21301                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21302 0000106C 2EA3[BE03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.environ],ax	
 21303                                  
 21304                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_com_line+2],ax ; set the seg.
 21305 00001070 2EA3[C203]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_line+2],ax
 21306                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_5c_fcb+2],ax
 21307 00001074 2EA3[C603]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_5c_fcb+2],ax
 21308                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_6c_fcb+2],ax
 21309 00001078 2EA3[CA03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_6c_fcb+2],ax
 21310 0000107C E86E00                  	call	sum_up
 21311 0000107F 26A3[5603]              	mov	[es:checksum],ax	; save the value of the sum
 21312 00001083 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21313 00001085 B44B                    	mov	ah,4Bh ; EXEC		; load/exec
 21314 00001087 BB[BE03]                	mov	bx,instexe		; es:bx -> parm block.
 21315 0000108A 06                      	push	es			; save es,ds for load/exec
 21316 0000108B 1E                      	push	ds			; these registers will be restored in sysinit_base.
 21317 0000108C 2EFF2E[4E03]            	jmp	far [cs:sysinit_base_ptr] ; jmp to sysinit_base to execute
 21318                                  					; load/exec function and check sum.
 21319

 21358                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21359                                  
 21360                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 21361                                  ;
 21362                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 21363                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 21364                                  ;
 21365                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 21366                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 21367                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 21368                                  
 21369                                  ParaRound:
 21370 000010AC 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 21371 000010AF D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 21372 000010B1 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21373 000010B3 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21374 000010B5 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21375 000010B7 C3                      	retn

 21377                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21378                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 21379                                  ;
 21380                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 21381                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 21382                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 21383                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21384                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21385                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21386                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21387                                  ;
 21388                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21389                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21390                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21391                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21392                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21393                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21394                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 21395                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21396                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21397                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21398                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21399                                  ;
 21400                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21401                                  
 21402                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21403                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21404                                  sysinit_base:				
 21405 000010B8 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 21406 000010BD 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 21407 000010C2 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 21408 000010C4 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 21409 000010C9 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 21410 000010CE 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 21411 000010CF 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 21412 000010D0 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 21413                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 21414                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 21415 000010D2 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 21416 000010D5 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 21417 000010DA 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 21418                                  
 21419                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 21420                                  
 21421 000010DC B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21422 000010DE 0E                      	push	cs
 21423 000010DF 1F                      	pop	ds
 21424 000010E0 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21425 000010E3 CD21                    	int	21h
 21426                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21427                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21428                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21429                                  _stall: 
 21430                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21431 000010E5 F4                      	hlt 
 21432                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21433                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 21434 000010E6 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 21435                                  
 21436                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 21437 000010E8 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 21438                                  
 21439                                  ;-------------------------------------
 21440                                  
 21441                                  sum_up:
 21442                                  
 21443                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21444                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21445                                  ;
 21446                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21447                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21448                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21449                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21450                                  ;
 21451                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21452                                  
 21453 000010ED 1E                      	push	ds
 21454                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21455                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21456 000010EE 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 21457 000010F2 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21458 000010F4 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21459 000010F6 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21460 000010F8 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21461                                  					;whole test better fail.
 21462 000010FD D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21463 000010FF 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21464                                  sum1:
 21465 00001101 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21466 00001103 46                      	inc	si
 21467 00001104 46                      	inc	si
 21468 00001105 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21469                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21470                                  sum_sys_code:
 21471                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21472 00001107 BE0611                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21473                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21474                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21475                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21476                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21477                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21478                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 21479                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 21480 0000110A B9[0038]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 21481 0000110D 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 21482 0000110F D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 21483                                  sum2:
 21484 00001111 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 21485 00001114 46                      	inc	si
 21486 00001115 46                      	inc	si
 21487 00001116 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 21488 00001118 1F                      	pop	ds
 21489 00001119 C3                      	retn
 21490                                  
 21491                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21492                                  
 21493                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 21494                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:
 21495 0000111A 0000                    	dw	0
 21496                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 21497                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:
 21498 0000111C 0000                    	dw	0

 21512                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21513                                  ; Set_Buffer
 21514                                  ;
 21515                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 21516                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 21517                                  ;
 21518                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 21519                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 21520                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 21521                                  ;
 21522                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 21523                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 21524                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 21530 00001139 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 21531 0000113B E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr

 21533 00001140 B201                    	mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA

 21536                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 21537 00001142 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 21538                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 21539 00001144 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es

 21541 00001147 C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 21542                                  
 21543 0000114C 89F8                    	mov	ax,di

 21545 00001153 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 21546

 21551 00001157 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 21552 00001159 E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 21553                                  
 21554 0000115B 2E2B3E[9B02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 21555                                  
 21556 00001160 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 21557                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 21558 00001161 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 21559 00001164 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 21560                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 21561                                  	; 25/10/2022

 21563                                  
 21564 0000116A 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMa ?
 21565 0000116C 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 21566                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 21567 0000116E C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 21568 00001172 2EA1[E003]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 21569                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 21570 00001176 C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 21571                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 21572 0000117B 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 21573 0000117E 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 21574                                  	;sub	ax,bufinsiz ; 20		; buffer head not required
 21575 00001182 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 21576                                  set_buff_2:

 21579 0000118A 2E800E[1814]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2

 21585                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21586                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21587                                  ;
 21588                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 21589                                  ;
 21590                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 21591                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 21592                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 21594                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21595                                  GetBufferAddr:
 21596 00001193 53                      	push	bx
 21597 00001194 52                      	push	dx
 21598 00001195 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 21599 00001199 2EF726[9702]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 21600                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 21601 0000119E 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 21602                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21603                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21604                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21605 000011A1 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 21606 000011A3 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21607 000011A5 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 21608                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 21609 000011A8 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 21610 000011AA 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 21611 000011AD 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 21612                                  
 21613                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 21614                                  	; 05/09/2023
 21615                                  	; zf=1
 21616 000011AF 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 21617                                  	; zf=1
 21618                                  
 21619                                  	;zf=1
 21620                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 21621                                  	;zf=1
 21622 000011B0 2E8E06[E003]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 21623                                  got_hma:
 21624 000011B5 5A                      	pop	dx
 21625 000011B6 5B                      	pop	bx
 21626 000011B7 C3                      	retn

 21643 000011BD 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]

 21646                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 21647 000011CA 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax

 21649 000011CD 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 21650                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 21651 000011D3 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0

 21656                                  ; ======================================================================
 21657                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21658                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21659                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21660                                  
 21661                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21662                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21663                                  ;
 21664                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21665                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21666                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21667                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21668                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21669                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21670                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21671                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21672                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21673                                  ;
 21674                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21675                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21676                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21677                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21678                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21679                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21680                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21681                                  ;	conditions:
 21682                                  ;
 21683                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21684                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21685                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21686                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21687                                  ;
 21688                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21689                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21690                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21691                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21692                                  ;
 21693                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21694                                  ;
 21695                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21696                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21697                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21698                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21699                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21700                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21701                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21702                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21703                                  ;
 21704                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21705                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21706                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21707                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21708                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 21709                                  ;
 21710                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21711                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21712                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21713                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21714                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21715                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21716                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21717                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21718                                  ;
 21719                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21720                                  
 21721                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21722                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21723                                  
 21724                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21725                                  stackinit:
 21726 000011E0 50                      	push	ax
 21727 000011E1 1E                      	push	ds
 21728 000011E2 06                      	push	es
 21729 000011E3 53                      	push	bx
 21730 000011E4 51                      	push	cx
 21731 000011E5 52                      	push	dx
 21732 000011E6 57                      	push	di
 21733 000011E7 56                      	push	si
 21734 000011E8 55                      	push	bp
 21735                                  
 21736                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21737                                  
 21738                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21739                                  	; ds = cs
 21740 000011E9 A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 21741 000011EC 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 21742                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21743                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 21744                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 21745 000011EE 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 21746                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 21747 000011F2 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 21748 000011F5 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 21749                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21750 000011F9 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 21751                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21752                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21753                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 21754 000011FC 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 21755                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21756 00001200 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 21757 00001202 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 21758                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21759                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21760                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 21761 00001205 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 21762                                  
 21763                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 21764                                  
 21765                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 21766                                  
 21767                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 21768                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21769                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 21770 00001209 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 21771                                  
 21772                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 21773                                  
 21774 0000120E B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 21775                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 21776                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21777                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 21778 00001211 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 21779 00001213 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 21780 00001215 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 21781 00001219 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21782 0000121B 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 21783                                  
 21784                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 21785                                  
 21786 0000121E 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 21787 00001223 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 21788 00001227 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 21789 00001229 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 21790 0000122B 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21791 0000122D 06                      	push	es
 21792 0000122E 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 21793                                  
 21794                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 21795                                  
 21796 0000122F 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 21797 00001233 FC                      	cld
 21798 00001234 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 21799                                  
 21800 00001236 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 21801                                  
 21802                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 21803                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 21804                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 21805                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 21806                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry
 21807                                  
 21808                                  buildloop:
 21809                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21810                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free	; mov [es:bp+0],0
 21811                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21812                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp],free
 21813                                  	; 14/08/2023
 21814 0000123A 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al ; 0 ; free

 21816                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1],al

 21818                                  	;mov	[es:bp2],ax
 21819 00001246 26894604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ax

 21821 0000124A 031E[0600]              	add	bx,[stacksize]

 21823                                  	;mov	[es:bp+6],bx

 21825 00001255 83C508                  	add	bp,entrysize ; 8
 21826

 21828                                  
 21829 0000125A 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize ; 8
 21830 0000125D 892E[0E00]              	mov	[lastentry],bp
 21831 00001261 892E[1000]              	mov	[nextentry],bp
 21832

 21834                                  	;mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte

 21838 0000126A 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ;convertible?
 21839 0000126F 1F                      	pop	ds
 21840 00001270 7504                    	jne	short skip_disablenmis
 21841

 21843 00001274 E672                    	out	72h,al
 21844                                  
 21845                                  skip_disablenmis:
 21846 00001276 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21847 00001278 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			;es - segid of vector table at 0

 22563                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22564                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22565                                  
 22566                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22567                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22568                                  
 22569                                  new_init_loop:
 22570                                  
 22571                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22572                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22573                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22574                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22575                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22576                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22577                                  
 22578 000013D2 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22579 000013D5 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22580 000013D7 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22581 000013DB 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22582                                  
 22583 000013DE 1E                      	push	ds
 22584                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22585                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22586                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22587 000013DF B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22588 000013E2 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22589 000013E4 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22590 000013E7 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22591 000013E9 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22592 000013ED 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 22593 000013F0 1F                      	pop	ds
 22594                                  
 22595 000013F1 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22596 000013F4 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22597 000013F8 C3                      	retn
 22598                                  
 22599                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 22600                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22601                                  
 22602                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22603                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 22604                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 22605                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 22606                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 22607                                  ;out: devmark established.
 22608                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 22609                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 22610                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22611                                  
 22612                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22613                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 22614                                  ; 04/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22615                                  ; (SYSINIT:176Ch)
 22616

 22618                                  
 22619                                  setdevmark:
 22620                                  
 22621                                  	; 04/09/2023
 22622                                  	;push	es
 22623                                  	;push	cx
 22624                                  
 22625 000013F9 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22626 000013FE 2E890E[1614]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 22627 00001403 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 22628                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22629                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 22630 00001405 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 22631 00001409 41                      	inc	cx
 22632                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 22633 0000140A 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 22634                                  
 22635                                  	; 04/09/2023
 22636                                  	;pop	cx
 22637                                  	;pop	es
 22638                                  	
 22639 0000140F 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 22640 00001414 C3                      	retn

 22841                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE

 22843                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 22844                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE

 22846                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="

 22849                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 22850                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22851                                  
 22852                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 22853                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk

 22865                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
