 22877                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 22878                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 22879 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 22880 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 22881 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 22882                                  endstruc
 22883                                  
 22884                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22885                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 22886                                  ;
 22887                                  ;
 22888                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 22889                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 22890                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22891                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22892                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22893                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22894                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22895                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22896                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22897                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22898                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22899                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 22900                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 22901                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 22902                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 22903                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 22904                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 22905                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 22906                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 22907                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 22908                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 22909                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 22910                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 22911                                  ;	   :
 22912                                  ;
 22913                                  ;Note:
 22914                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 22915                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22916                                  ;
 22917                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22918                                  ;
 22919                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22920                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22921                                  ;
 22922                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22923                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22924                                  ;
 22925                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22926                                  ;
 22927                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22928                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22929                                  ;
 22930                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22931                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22932                                  ;
 22933                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 22934                                  ;
 22935                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22936                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 22937                                  ;
 22938                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22939                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22940                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22941                                  ;
 22942                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 22943                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 22944                                  ;
 22945                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 22946                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 22947                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 22948                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22949                                  
 22950                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 22951                                  
 22952                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 22953                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 22954                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 22955                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 22956                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 22957                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 22958                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 22959                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 22960                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 22961                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 22962                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 22963                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 22964                                  
 22965                                  ;**** Function flags
 22966                                  
 22967                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 22968                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 22969                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 22970                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 22971                                  
 22972                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 22973                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 22974 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 22975 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 22976 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 22977 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 22978 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 22979 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 22980                                  endstruc
 22981                                  
 22982                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22983                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 22984                                  ;
 22985                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 22986                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 22987                                  ;	     +-
 22988                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 22989                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 22990                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 22991                                  ;	     |	:
 22992                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22993                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 22994                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 22995                                  ;	     |	:
 22996                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22997                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 22998                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 22999                                  ;	     +-	:
 23000                                  ;
 23001                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23002                                  ;
 23003                                  ;Note:
 23004                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23005                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23006                                  ;
 23007                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23008                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23009                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23010                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23011                                  
 23012                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23013                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23014                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23015                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23016                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23017                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23018                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23019                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23020                                  
 23021                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23022 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23023 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23024 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23025 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23026 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23027                                  endstruc
 23028                                  
 23029                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23030                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23031                                  ;
 23032                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23033                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23034                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23035                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23036                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23037                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23038                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23039                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23040                                  ;
 23041                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23042                                  ;
 23043                                  ;            +-
 23044                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23045                                  ;	    | or
 23046                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23047                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23048                                  ;	    | or
 23049                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23050                                  ;	    | or
 23051                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23052                                  ;	    | or
 23053                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23054                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23055                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23056                                  ;	    | or
 23057                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23058                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23059                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23060                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23061                                  ;	    +-
 23062                                  ;
 23063                                  ;
 23064                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 23065                                  ;      list.
 23066                                  ;
 23067                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 23068                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 23069                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 23070                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23071                                  
 23072                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure

 23076 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 23077 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 23078                                  endstruc

 23160                                  ; (tm06) IF FileSW			;AN000;(Check if file spec is supported)
 23161                                  ;

 23163                                  ;M029
 23164                                  ;!!!WARNING!!!
 23165                                  ; In routine SYSPARSE (parse.asm), _$P_FileSp_Char is reinitialized using 
 23166                                  ;hardcoded strings. If the chars in the string are changed here, corresponding
 23167                                  ;changes need to be made in SYSPARSE

 23189                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 23190                                  ; ======================================================================
 23191                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23192                                  
 23193                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23194                                  ; SysParse;
 23195                                  ;
 23196                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23197                                  ;
 23198                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23199                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23200                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23201                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23202                                  ;
 23203                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23204                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23205                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23206                                  ;
 23207                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 23208                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 23209                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 23210                                  ;
 23211                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 23212                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 23213                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 23214                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 23215                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 23216                                  ;
 23217                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23218                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 23219                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 23220                                  ;
 23221                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 23222                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 23223                                  ;
 23224                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 23225                                  ;
 23226                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 23227                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 23228                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 23229                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 23230                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 23231                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 23232                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23233                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23234                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 23235                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 23236                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 23237                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 23238                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 23239                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 23240                                  ;	     (tm08)
 23241                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 23242                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 23243                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 23244                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 23245                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 23246                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 23247                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 23248                                  ;					  (tm12)

 23250                                  ;					  (tm13)

 23252                                  ;					  (tm14)
 23253                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 23254                                  ;					  (tm15)

 23256                                  
 23257                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 23258                                  
 23259                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 23260                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 23261                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 23262                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 23263                                  
 23264                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 23265                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 23266                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 23267                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 23268                                  ;
 23269                                  
 23270                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 23271                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 23272                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 23273                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 23274                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 23275                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 23276                                  
 23277                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 23278                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 23279                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 23280                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 23281                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 23282                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 23283                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 23284                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 23285                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 23286                                  
 23287                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 23288                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 23289                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 23290                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 23291                                  ;	     segment.
 23292

 23294                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS

 23297                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in

 23890                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23891                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 23892                                  ;
 23893                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 23894                                  ;
 23895                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 23896                                  ;	    AL = type
 23897                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 23898                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 23899                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 23900                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 23901                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 23902                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 23903                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 23904                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23905                                  ;
 23906                                  ; Output:   None
 23907                                  ;
 23908                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 23909                                  ;
 23910                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 23911                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23912                                  
 23913                                  _$P_Fill_Result:
 23914 000016D5 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 23915 000016D6 268B7F04                	mov	di,[es:bx+_$P_Control_Blk.Result_Buf]
 23916                                  					;AN000; di points to result buffer
 23917 000016DA 2E893E[2314]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DX],di		;AC034; set returned result address
 23918                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Type],al ;AN000; store type
 23919                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],ah ;AN000; store item tag
 23920                                  	; 07/09/2023
 23921                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Type], ax
 23922 000016DF 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax		; store type (al) and item tag (ah)
 23923                                  
 23924 000016E2 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 23925 000016E3 2EA1[3214]              	mov	ax,[cs:_$P_Found_SYNONYM] ;AC034; if yes,
 23926 000016E7 26894502                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],ax

 24306                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24307                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue

 24310                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 24311                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 24312                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 24313                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 24314                                  ;
 24315                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 24316                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24317                                  ;
 24318                                  ; Output:    None
 24319                                  ;
 24320                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 24321                                  ;
 24322                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 24323                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24324                                  
 24325                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24326                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 24327                                  
 24328                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 24329 00001884 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24330 00001885 2E800E[2B14]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 24331 0000188B 2E8026[2B14]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 24332 00001891 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 24333 00001894 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 24334 00001896 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 24335                                  
 24336 00001898 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 24337 0000189A 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 24338                                  
 24339 0000189C 2E800E[2B14]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 24340                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 24341 000018A2 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 24342                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 24343 000018A3 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 24344 000018A6 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24345 000018A7 C3                      	retn

 24558                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24559                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 24560                                  ;
 24561                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 24562                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 24563                                  ;
 24564                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 24565                                  ;
 24566                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 24567                                  ;
 24568                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 24569                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24570                                  
 24571                                  	; 26/10/2022
 24572                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 24573 0000198F 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 24574 00001990 2EF606[2B14]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 24575 00001996 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 24576                                  
 24577 00001998 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 24578 00001999 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24579                                  
 24580                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 24581 0000199A 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 24582 0000199B 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 24583                                  
 24584 0000199D F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 24585 0000199E C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 24586                                  
 24587                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 24588                                  _$P_0099Err: ; 14/08/2023
 24589 0000199F F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 24590                                  _$P_0099Err2: ; 14/08/2023
 24591 000019A0 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24592                                  
 24593                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24594                                  ; _$P_0099;

 24597                                  ;
 24598                                  ; Input:     AL = character code
 24599                                  ;
 24600                                  ; Output:    CY = 1 : AL is not number
 24601                                  ;	     CY = 0 : AL contains binary value
 24602                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24603

 24605 000019A1 3C30                    	cmp	al,"0"                  ;AN000;

 24609

 24614                                  	; 12/12/2022

 24617 000019AB C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24618                                  
 24619                                  	; 14/08/2023
 24620                                  ;_$P_0099Err:				;AN000;
 24621                                  ;	stc				;AN000; indicate error

 24623                                  ;	retn				;AN000;

 25200                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 25201                                  ;
 25202                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 25203                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 25204                                  ;	    blanks.

 25207                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 25208                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List

 25211                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 25212                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 25213                                  ;***********************************************************************

 25296                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25297                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 25298                                  ;
 25299                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 25300                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 25301                                  ;
 25302                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25303                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 25304                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 25305                                  ;
 25306                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 25307                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 25308                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 25309                                  
 25310                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 25311                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 25312                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 25313                                  ;
 25314                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 25315                                  
 25316                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 25317                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25318                                  
 25319                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 25320                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 25321                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 25322                                  	; 14/08/2023
 25323 00001C1D BD[3414]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 25324                                  
 25325                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 25326 00001C20 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 25327 00001C22 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 25328                                  
 25329                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 25330 00001C24 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25331 00001C26 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 25332                                  
 25333 00001C28 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 25334                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25335                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25336 00001C29 C3                      	retn
 25337                                  
 25338                                  ; 12/12/2022
 25339                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 25340                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 25341                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25342                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 25343                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25344                                  
 25345                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 25346                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 25347 00001C2A 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25348 00001C2C 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 25349                                  
 25350 00001C2E 2E800E[2B14]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 25351                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25352                                  
 25353                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25354                                  	; cf=0
 25355                                  	;retn
 25356                                  
 25357                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 25358                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25359                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 25360 00001C34 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 25361                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25362                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 25363 00001C35 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25366                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25367                                  ;
 25368                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 25369                                  ;
 25370                                  ;  Input:
 25371                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 25372                                  ;
 25373                                  ;  Output:
 25374                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 25375                                  ;
 25376                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 25377                                  ;
 25378                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 25379                                  ;***************************************************************************
 25380                                  
 25381                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25382 00001C36 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 25383 00001C37 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25384 00001C38 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)

 25389 00001C3E 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 25390 00001C40 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 25391 00001C42 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25392 00001C43 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25393 00001C44 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25394 00001C45 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25395 00001C46 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 25396 00001C47 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 25397 00001C48 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 25398                                  	; si = 0 ; 14/08/2023
 25399                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 25400 00001C49 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 25401 00001C4B B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 25402 00001C4E CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 25403                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 25404 00001C50 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25405 00001C52 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25406 00001C54 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 25407 00001C55 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 25408 00001C56 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 25409 00001C57 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 25410 00001C58 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25411 00001C59 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25412 00001C5A 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25413 00001C5B 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 25414                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 25415 00001C5D 2E8936[2614]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 25416 00001C62 2E891E[2814]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 25417                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 25418                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 25419                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 25420                                  	; 14/08/2023
 25421 00001C67 2EC536[2614]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 25422                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 25423 00001C6C 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 25424 00001C6F 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 25425 00001C71 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 25426 00001C73 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 25427 00001C75 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 25428 00001C78 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 25429 00001C7A F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 25430 00001C7B EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 25431                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 25432 00001C7D 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 25433 00001C7E 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 25434                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 25435 00001C7F EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 25436                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 25437                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25438                                  	; cf=0
 25439                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 25440                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;

 25442 00001C82 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25443 00001C83 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;

 26000                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26001                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26002                                  
 26003                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 26004                                  ;
 26005                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 26006                                  ;
 26007                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26008                                  ;
 26009                                  ;   Modification log:
 26010                                  ;
 26011                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 26012                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 26013                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 26014                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 26015                                  ;
 26016                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26017                                  ;
 26018                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 26019                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 26020                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 26021                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 26022                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 26023                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 26024                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 26025                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 26026                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 26027                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 26028                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 26029                                  ;
 26030                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26031                                  
 26032                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 26033                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 26034                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 26035                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 26036                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 26037                                  
 26038                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 26039                                  
 26040                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 26041                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 26042                                  
 26043                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 26044                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 26045                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 26046                                  
 26047                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 26048                                  ;
 26049                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 26050                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 26051                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 26052                                  ;	           line.
 26053                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 26054                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 26055                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 26056                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 26057                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 26058                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 26059                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 26060                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 26061                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 26062                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 26063                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 26064                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 26065                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 26066                                  ;	           for details).
 26067                                  
 26068                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 26069                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 26070                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 26071                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 26072                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 26073                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 26074                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 26075                                  fm_strat: db	0
 26076                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 26077                                  
 26078                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 26079                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 26080                                  
 26081                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 26082                                  
 26083                                  %endif
 26084

 26205                                  ;;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 26206                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear

 26287 00001F21 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 26288 00001F23 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax

 26290                                  conferr:

 26298                                  ; entry : multi_pass

 26300                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands

 26305                                  multi_pass:
 26306 00001F2E 0E                      	push	cs
 26307 00001F2F 1F                      	pop	ds
 26308                                  
 26309 00001F30 803E[4903]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 26310                                  ;jae_endconv:
 26311 00001F35 73F6                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 26312                                  
 26313                                  	;push	word [CONFBOT]
 26314                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26315 00001F37 FF36[A102]              	push	word [top_of_cdss]
 26316 00001F3B 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 26317                                  
 26318 00001F3C 8B36[D403]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 26319 00001F40 8936[D203]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 26320 00001F44 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 26321 00001F46 8936[D603]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 26322 00001F4A 8936[2B03]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 26323                                  
 26324 00001F4E E89710                  	call	getchr
 26325 00001F51 EB06                    	jmp	short conflp
 26326                                  
 26327                                  getcom:
 26328 00001F53 E87B0E                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 26329 00001F56 E88F10                  	call	getchr
 26330                                  conflp: 
 26331 00001F59 72D2                    	jc	short endconv
 26332                                  
 26333 00001F5B FF06[2B03]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 26334                                  
 26335 00001F5F C606[1514]00            	mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 26336 00001F64 C606[1814]00            	mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 26337 00001F69 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 26338 00001F6B 7416                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 26339                                  
 26340                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26341                                  %if 0
 26342                                  
 26343                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26344                                  
 26345                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 26346                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 26347                                  
 26348                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 26349                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 26350                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 26351                                          cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 26352                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 26353                                  
 26354                                          push    ax                      ;
 26355                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 26356                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 26357                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 26358                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 26359                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 26360                                          pop     ax
 26361                                  ;
 26362                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 26363                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 26364                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 26365                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 26366                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 26367                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 26368                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 26369                                  ;   spot.
 26370                                  ;
 26371                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 26372                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 26373                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 26374                                  ;   retrieved.
 26375                                  ;
 26376                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 26377                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 26378                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 26379                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26380                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 26381                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 26382                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 26383                                  final:                                  ;
 26384                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 26385                                  not_final:                              ;
 26386                                  ;endif
 26387                                  
 26388                                  %endif
 26389 00001F6D 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 26390 00001F6F E87610                  	call	getchr
 26391 00001F72 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 26392                                  
 26393 00001F74 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 26394                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 26395                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26396 00001F79 73B2                    	jnb	short endconv	
 26397 00001F7B E9FB06                  	jmp	badop
 26398                                  	
 26399                                  coff:	
 26400                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26401                                  	; ds = cs
 26402                                  	;push	cs
 26403                                  	;pop	ds
 26404 00001F7E E85E10                  	call	newline

 26408 00001F83 E86210                  	call	getchr
 26409 00001F86 EBD1                    	jmp	short conflp
 26410                                  
 26411                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26412                                  ; 11/12/2022
 26413                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 26414                                  ;coff_p:
 26415                                  	;push	cs
 26416                                  	;pop	ds
 26417                                  
 26418                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 26419                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 26420                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 26421                                  ;install= command.

 26423                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26424                                  ;install command
 26425                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26426                                  
 26427                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26428                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 26429                                  tryi:
 26430 00001F88 803E[4903]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI

 26556                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26557                                  ;									      *
 26558                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 26559                                  ;									      *
 26560                                  ; input :								      *
 26561                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26562                                  ; output:								      *
 26563                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 26564                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 26565                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 26566                                  ;									      *
 26567                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 26568                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *

 26570                                  ; {									      *
 26571                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *

 26575                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *

 26577                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 26578                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 26579                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 26580                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 26581                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 26582                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 26583                                  ;	};								      *
 26584                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 26585                                  ; };									      *
 26586                                  ;									      *

 26679                                  ;****************************************************************************

 28102                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28103                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 28104                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 28105                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 28106                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 28107                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 28108                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 28109                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 28110                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28111                                  
 28112                                  ;**************************************************************************
 28113                                  ;									  *
 28114                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 28115                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 28116                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 28117                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 28118                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 28119                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 28120                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 28121                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 28122                                  ; input :								  *
 28123                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 28124                                  ; output:								  *
 28125                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 28126                                  ;									  *
 28127                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 28128                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 28129                                  ; logic:								  *
 28130                                  ; {									  *
 28131                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 28132                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 28133                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 28134                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 28135                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 28136                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 28137                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28138                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 28139                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28140                                  ;	     }								  *
 28141                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 28142                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 28143                                  ;	};								  *
 28144                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 28145                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 28146                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 28147                                  ; };									  *
 28148                                  ;**************************************************************************
 28149

 28151                                          ;if      stacksw
 28152

 28815                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28816                                  
 28817                                  sysinit_parse:
 28818                                  
 28819                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28820                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 28821                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 28822                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 28823                                  ;
 28824                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 28825                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 28826                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 28827                                  ;	*** after each call.
 28828                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 28829                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 28830                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 28831                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 28832                                  ;	 procedure.
 28833                                  ;	ax - exit code
 28834                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 28835                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 28836                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 28837                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer
 28838                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28839                                  
 28840                                  	; 24/10/2022
 28841 0000265A 06                      	push	es			;save es,ds
 28842 0000265B 1E                      	push	ds
 28843                                  
 28844                                  	; 09/09/2023
 28845                                  	; ds = cs

 29179                                  ;
 29180                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 29181                                  ;
 29182                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 29183                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 29184                                  ;
 29185                                  ;	Output : none
 29186                                  ;
 29187                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 29188                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 29189                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29190                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 29191                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29192                                  ;
 29193                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29194                                  
 29195                                  LieInt12Mem:
 29196                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29197                                  	; ds = cs
 29198 000026FF A1[A302]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 29199                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 29200                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 29201 00002702 E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 29202 00002705 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 29203                                  	; 13/05/2019
 29204                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 29205                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 29206                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 29207                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29208                                  	; ds = cs
 29209 00002707 803E[851E]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 29210 0000270C 74F0                    	je	short limx
 29211 0000270E A1[6C1E]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 29212                                  lim_set:
 29213                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 29214                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29215                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 29216                                  ;limx:
 29217                                  	;retn
 29218                                  	
 29219                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 29220                                  
 29221                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29222                                  ;
 29223                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 29224                                  ;
 29225                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 29226                                  ;	Output : none
 29227                                  ;
 29228                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 29229                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 29230                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 29231                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 29232                                  ;
 29233                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29234                                  
 29235                                  	; 01/11/2022
 29236                                  SetInt12Mem:
 29237 00002711 1E                      	push	ds
 29238 00002712 BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 29239 00002715 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 29240 00002717 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 29241 0000271B 2E891E[891E]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 29242 00002720 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 29243 00002722 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 29244 00002724 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 29245 00002727 2EC606[881E]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 29246 0000272D 1F                      	pop	ds
 29247                                  ;limx:
 29248 0000272E C3                      	retn
 29249                                  
 29250                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29251                                  ;
 29252                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 29253                                  ;
 29254                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 29255                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 29256                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 29257                                  ;
 29258                                  ;	Output : none
 29259                                  ;
 29260                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 29261                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 29262                                  ;
 29263                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29264                                  
 29265                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 29266                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29267                                  	; ds = cs
 29268 0000272F 803E[881E]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29269                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 29270                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 29271                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 29272 00002734 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 29273                                  	; 18/12/2022
 29274 00002736 B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 29275 00002739 8826[881E]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 29276                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29277                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 29278 0000273D 1E                      	push	ds
 29279                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 29280 0000273E 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 29281 00002740 2EA1[891E]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 29282 00002744 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 29283 00002747 1F                      	pop	ds
 29284                                  timx:
 29285 00002748 C3                      	retn
 29286

 29311 0000275B F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb
 29312 0000275D 5E                      	pop	si
 29313 0000275E 07                      	pop	es

 29315 00002760 C3                      	retn

 29337                                  %if 0
 29338                                  
 29339                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 29340                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 29341                                  
 29342                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29343                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 29344                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29345                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29346                                  
 29347                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29348                                  ;
 29349                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 29350                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 29351                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 29352                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 29353                                  ;
 29354                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 29355                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 29356                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 29357                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 29358                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 29359                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 29360                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 29361                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 29362                                  ; available during the load.
 29363                                  ;
 29364                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
