 29365                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 29366                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 29367                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 29368                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 29369                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 29370                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 29371                                  ;
 29372                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 29373                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 29374                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 29375                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 29376                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 29377                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 29378                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 29379                                  ;
 29380                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29381                                  
 29382                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 29383                                  
 29384                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 29385                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 29386                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 29387                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 29388                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 29389                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 29390                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 29391                                  
 29392                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 29393                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 29394                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 29395                                  
 29396                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29397                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 29398                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29399                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 29400                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 29401                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 29402                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29403                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29404                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 29405                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 29406                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29407                                  
 29408                                  InitVar:
 29409                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 29410                                  	push	ax
 29411                                  	push	cx
 29412                                  	push	di
 29413                                  	push	es
 29414                                  
 29415                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 29416                                  	push	cs
 29417                                  	pop	es
 29418                                  
 29419                                  	xor	ax,ax
 29420                                  	mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 29421                                  	mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 29422                                  	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 29423                                  	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 29424                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 29425                                  	mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 29426                                  
 29427                                  	cld
 29428                                  
 29429                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 29430                                  	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 29431                                  	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 29432                                  
 29433                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 29434                                  	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 29435                                  	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 29436                                  
 29437                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 29438                                  
 29439                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 29440                                  	pop	es
 29441                                  	pop	di
 29442                                  	pop	cx
 29443                                  	pop	ax	 	
 29444                                  
 29445                                  	retn
 29446                                  
 29447                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29448                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 29449                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29450                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 29451                                  ; EXIT    : None
 29452                                  ; ERROR   : None
 29453                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 29454                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29455                                  
 29456                                  FixMem:
 29457                                  	push	ax
 29458                                  	push	bx
 29459                                  	push	cx
 29460                                  	push	dx
 29461                                  	push	es
 29462                                  
 29463                                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 29464                                  
 29465                                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 29466                                  	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 29467                                  
 29468                                  	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 29469                                  
 29470                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 29471                                  
 29472                                  	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 29473                                  	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 29474                                  	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 29475                                  
 29476                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29477                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 29478                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 29479                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29480                                  
 29481                                  fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 29482                                  	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 29483                                  	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 29484                                  	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 29485                                  
 29486                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 29487                                  
 29488                                  fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 29489                                  	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 29490                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 29491                                  
 29492                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 29493                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 29494                                  	; 14/08/2023
 29495                                  	inc	bx
 29496                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 29497                                  
 29498                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 29499                                  
 29500                                  fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 29501                                  	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 29502                                  
 29503                                  	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 29504                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 29505                                  	inc	bx
 29506                                  	mov	es,bx
 29507                                  
 29508                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 29509                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 29510                                  	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 29511                                  fmX:	
 29512                                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 29513                                  
 29514                                  	pop	es
 29515                                  	pop	dx
 29516                                  	pop	cx
 29517                                  	pop	bx
 29518                                  	pop	ax
 29519                                  
 29520                                  	retn
 29521                                  
 29522                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29523                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 29524                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29525                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29526                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 29527                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29528                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 29529                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29530                                  
 29531                                  fm_link:
 29532                                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 29533                                  	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 29534                                  
 29535                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 29536                                  	;
 29537                                  	;push	es
 29538                                  	;push	cs
 29539                                  	;pop	es
 29540                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 29541                                  	;pop	es
 29542                                  	
 29543                                  	mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 29544                                  
 29545                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29546                                  	mov	bx,1
 29547                                  	int	21h
 29548                                  	retn
 29549                                  
 29550                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29551                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 29552                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29553                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 29554                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29555                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29556                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 29557                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29558                                  
 29559                                  fm_unlink:
 29560                                  	xor	bx,bx
 29561                                  	
 29562                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 29563                                  	;
 29564                                  	;push	ds
 29565                                  	;push	cs
 29566                                  	;pop	ds
 29567                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 29568                                  	;pop	ds
 29569                                  	
 29570                                  	mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 29571                                  
 29572                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29573                                  	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 29574                                  	retn
 29575                                  
 29576                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29577                                  
 29578                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29579                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 29580                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 29581                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29582                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 29583                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 29584                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 29585                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29586                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29587                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 29588                                  ;
 29589                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 29590                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 29591                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29592                                  ;
 29593                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 29594                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 29595                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 29596                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 29597                                  ;
 29598                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 29599                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 29600                                  ;
 29601                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29602                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 29603                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 29604                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 29605                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 29606                                  ;     lh
 29607                                  ;     /l
 29608                                  ;     1
 29609                                  ;     1000
 29610                                  ;     2
 29611                                  ;     print
 29612                                  ;     /d
 29613                                  ;     :lpt2
 29614                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 29615                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 29616                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 29617                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 29618                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 29619                                  ; for:
 29620                                  ;    Each /L
 29621                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 29622                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 29623                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 29624                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 29625                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 29626                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29627                                  
 29628                                  ParseVar:
 29629                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 29630                                  	push	di
 29631                                  	push	ds
 29632                                  	push	es
 29633                                  
 29634                                  	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 29635                                  	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 29636                                  	cld
 29637                                  
 29638                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29639                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 29640                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29641                                  
 29642                                  pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 29643                                  	call	isWhite
 29644                                  	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 29645                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29646                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH
 29647                                  	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 29648                                  
 29649                                  	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 29650                                  	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 29651                                  	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 29652                                  
 29653                                  pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 29654                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 29655                                  	and	al,0DFh
 29656                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 29657                                  	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 29658                                  	jne	short pv30
 29659                                  
 29660                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29661                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29662                                  
 29663                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 29664                                  	;
 29665                                  	;push	es
 29666                                  	;push	cs
 29667                                  	;pop	es
 29668                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 29669                                  	;pop	es
 29670                                  
 29671                                  	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 29672                                  
 29673                                  	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 29674                                  
 29675                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 29676                                  	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 29677                                  	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 29678                                  
 29679                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29680                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29681                                  
 29682                                  	call	parseL
 29683                                  	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 29684                                  
 29685                                  	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 29686                                  	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 29687                                  
 29688                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 29689                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29690                                  pvErr:	dec	si
 29691                                  	dec	si
 29692                                  	stc
 29693                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 29694                                  	pop	es
 29695                                  	pop	ds
 29696                                  	pop	di
 29697                                  	retn
 29698                                  
 29699                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29700                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 29701                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29702                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 29703                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 29704                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 29705                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 29706                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29707                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 29708                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 29709                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 29710                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 29711                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29712                                  
 29713                                  parseL:
 29714                                  	lodsb
 29715                                  	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 29716                                  	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 29717                                  
 29718                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29719                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 29720                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29721                                  
 29722                                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 29723                                  	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 29724                                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 29725                                  
 29726                                  	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 29727                                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 29728                                  	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 29729                                  
 29730                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 29731                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29732                                  
 29733                                  	lodsb
 29734                                  	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 29735                                  	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 29736                                  
 29737                                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 29738                                  	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 29739                                  
 29740                                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 29741                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29742                                  
 29743                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29744                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 29745                                  	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 29746                                  
 29747                                  	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 29748                                  	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 29749                                  
 29750                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 29751                                  
 29752                                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 29753                                  	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 29754                                  
 29755                                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 29756                                  
 29757                                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 29758                                  
 29759                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 29760                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29761                                  
 29762                                  	lodsb
 29763                                  	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 29764                                  	je	short pl10	;
 29765                                  
 29766                                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 29767                                  	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 29768                                  
 29769                                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 29770                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29771                                  
 29772                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29773                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 29774                                  	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 29775                                  plE1:	
 29776                                  	;mov	ax,1
 29777                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 29778                                  	dec	si
 29779                                  	stc
 29780                                  	retn
 29781                                  
 29782                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 29783                                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 29784                                  	; 12/12/2022
 29785                                  	; cf=1
 29786                                  	;stc
 29787                                  	retn
 29788                                  plSwX:	
 29789                                  	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 29790                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 29791                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 29792                                  	; cf=0
 29793                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 29794                                  	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 29795                                  
 29796                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29797                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 29798                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29799                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29800                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29801                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29802                                  ; USES:     fm_argc, flags
 29803                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29804                                  
 29805                                  ;incArgc:
 29806                                  	;push	ax
 29807                                  
 29808                                  	;;getdata al, fm_argc	; Obtain previous value of fm_argc,
 29809                                  
 29810                                  	;mov	al,[cs:fm_argc]
 29811                                  
 29812                                  	;inc	al		; Increment it,
 29813                                  
 29814                                  	;;putdata fm_argc, al	; And store it right back.
 29815                                  
 29816                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_argc],al
 29817                                  
 29818                                  	;pop	ax
 29819                                  	;retn
 29820                                  
 29821                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29822                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29823                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29824                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29825                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29826                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29827                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29828                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29829                                  
 29830                                  isEOL:
 29831                                  	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 29832                                  	je	short ieX
 29833                                  	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 29834                                  	je	short ieX
 29835                                  	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 29836                                  ieX:	
 29837                                  	retn
 29838                                  
 29839                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29840                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 29841                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29842                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29843                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 29844                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29845                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29846                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29847                                  
 29848                                  isWhite:
 29849                                  	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 29850                                  	je	short iwX
 29851                                  	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 29852                                  	je	short iwX
 29853                                  	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 29854                                  iwX:	
 29855                                  	retn
 29856                                  
 29857                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29858                                  ;*** unMarkUMB - marks a given UMB as unused, even if previously marked used
 29859                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29860                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number
 29861                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29862                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29863                                  ; USES:     Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29864                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29865                                  
 29866                                  unMarkUMB:
 29867                                  	push	ax
 29868                                  	push	bx
 29869                                  	push	di
 29870                                  	push	es
 29871                                  
 29872                                  	push	cs
 29873                                  	pop	es
 29874                                  
 29875                                  	xor	ah,ah
 29876                                  	mov	bx,ax
 29877                                  
 29878                                  	; 19/04/2019
 29879                                  	
 29880                                  	;mov	byte [es:bx+UmbUsed],0
 29881                                  	mov	[es:bx+UmbUsed],ah ; 0
 29882                                  
 29883                                  	cmp	[es:UmbLoad],al
 29884                                  	jne	short umu10
 29885                                  
 29886                                  	;mov	[es:UmbLoad],0	; If unmarked the load UMB, load into convent.
 29887                                  	mov	[es:UmbLoad],ah ; 0
 29888                                  umu10:	
 29889                                  	pop	es
 29890                                  	pop	di
 29891                                  	pop	bx
 29892                                  	pop	ax
 29893                                  	retn
 29894                                  
 29895                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29896                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 29897                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 29898                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 29899                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 29900                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29901                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 29902                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29903                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 29904                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29905                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29906                                  
 29907                                  stowUMB:
 29908                                  	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 29909                                  	jb	short su10
 29910                                  	stc
 29911                                  	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 29912                                  su10:	
 29913                                  	push	bx
 29914                                  	push	di
 29915                                  	push	si
 29916                                  	push	ds
 29917                                  	push	es
 29918                                  	push	cs
 29919                                  	pop	es
 29920                                  	push	cs
 29921                                  	pop	ds
 29922                                  	
 29923                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 29924                                  	cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 29925                                  	jne	short su20
 29926                                  	mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 29927                                  su20:	
 29928                                  	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 29929                                  	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 29930                                  
 29931                                  	mov	bl,al
 29932                                  	xor	bh,bh
 29933                                  	mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 29934                                  
 29935                                  	xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 29936                                  
 29937                                  	or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 29938                                  	jz	short su30	; means an error.
 29939                                  
 29940                                  	stc			; OOOPS!  This one's been used before.  :(
 29941                                  su30:	
 29942                                  	pop	es
 29943                                  	pop	ds
 29944                                  	pop	si
 29945                                  	pop	di
 29946                                  	pop	bx
 29947                                  	retn
 29948                                  
 29949                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29950                                  ;*** stowSiz - marks a given UMB as having a given minimum size
 29951                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29952                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains UMB number, AX contains size
 29953                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29954                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29955                                  ; USES:     AX, DX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29956                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29957                                  
 29958                                  ; 13/05/2019
 29959                                  
 29960                                  stowSiz:
 29961                                  	push	bx
 29962                                  	;push	di ; ?
 29963                                  	push	es
 29964                                  
 29965                                  	push	cs
 29966                                  	pop	es	
 29967                                  
 29968                                  	mov	bl,cl			; Now bl==UMB number, AX==size
 29969                                  	mov	bh,0			;     bx==UMB number, AX==size
 29970                                  	shl	bl,1			;     bx==offset into array, AX=size
 29971                                  	mov	[es:bx+UmbSize],ax	; Store the size
 29972                                  	
 29973                                  	pop	es
 29974                                  	;pop	di ; ?
 29975                                  	pop	bx
 29976                                  
 29977                                  	retn
 29978                                  
 29979                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29980                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 29981                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 29982                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 29983                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 29984                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29985                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 29986                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 29987                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 29988                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 29989                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29990                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 29991                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 29992                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 29993                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29994                                  
 29995                                  gnradix:
 29996                                  	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 29997                                  
 29998                                  toDigit:
 29999                                  	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 30000                                  	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 30001                                  
 30002                                  toDigit_hex:
 30003                                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 30004                                  	jb	short td10
 30005                                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 30006                                  	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 30007                                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 30008                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 30009                                  	retn
 30010                                  td10:	
 30011                                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 30012                                  	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 30013                                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 30014                                  	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 30015                                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 30016                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 30017                                  	retn
 30018                                  toDigit_dec:
 30019                                  td20:	
 30020                                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 30021                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 30022                                  	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 30023                                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 30024                                  	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 30025                                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 30026                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 30027                                  	retn
 30028                                  tdE:	
 30029                                  	stc
 30030                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 30031                                  	retn
 30032                                  
 30033                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30034                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 30035                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30036                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 30037                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 30038                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 30039                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 30040                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30041                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 30042                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 30043                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 30044                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30045                                  
 30046                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30047                                  
 30048                                  GetXNum:
 30049                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 30050                                  	push	bx
 30051                                  	push	cx
 30052                                  	push	ds
 30053                                  
 30054                                  	cld
 30055                                  	xor	ax,ax
 30056                                  	xor	bx,bx
 30057                                  	xor	cx,cx
 30058                                  	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 30059                                  
 30060                                  	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 30061                                  
 30062                                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 30063                                  	;call	toDigit
 30064                                  	call	toDigit_dec
 30065                                  	jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 30066                                  
 30067                                  	or	cl,cl
 30068                                  	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 30069                                  	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 30070                                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 30071                                  	je	short gxn10
 30072                                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 30073                                  	jne	short gxn20
 30074                                  
 30075                                  gxn10:	
 30076                                  	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 30077                                  	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 30078                                  	inc	si
 30079                                  
 30080                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 30081                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 30082                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 30083                                  ;        BX    = 0
 30084                                  ;        CH    = 0
 30085                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 30086                                  
 30087                                  gxn20:	
 30088                                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 30089                                  	inc	si
 30090                                  
 30091                                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 30092                                  	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 30093                                  
 30094                                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 30095                                  	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 30096                                  
 30097                                  	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 30098                                  	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 iff last add wrapped
 30099                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 30100                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 30101                                  	jnc	short gxn20
 30102                                  gxnE:	
 30103                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 30104                                  	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 30105                                  gxnQ:	
 30106                                  	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 30107                                  	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 30108                                  gxnX:	
 30109                                  	pop	ds
 30110                                  	pop	cx
 30111                                  	pop	bx
 30112                                  	retn
 30113                                  
 30114                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30115                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 30116                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30117                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 30118                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 30119                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 30120                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 30121                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30122                                  
 30123                                  mul32:
 30124                                  	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 30125                                  	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 30126                                  	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 30127                                  	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 30128                                  
 30129                                  	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 30130                                  	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 30131                                  
 30132                                  	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 30133                                  	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 30134                                  	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 30135                                  	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 30136                                  	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 30137                                  	retn
 30138                                  m32E:	
 30139                                  	pop	ax
 30140                                  	retn
 30141                                  
 30142                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30143                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 30144                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30145                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 30146                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 30147                                  ; ERROR:   None
 30148                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 30149                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30150                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 30151                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 30152                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30153                                  
 30154                                  toPara:
 30155                                  	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 30156                                  
 30157                                  	mov	cl,4		;
 30158                                  	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 30159                                  	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 30160                                  	mov	cl,12
 30161                                  	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 30162                                  	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 30163                                  
 30164                                  	pop	cx
 30165                                  	retn
 30166                                  
 30167                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30168                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 30169                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30170                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 30171                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 30172                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 30173                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 30174                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30175                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 30176                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 30177                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 30178                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 30179                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30180                                  
 30181                                  UmbHead:
 30182                                  	; 13/05/2019 (because of callers, pushs & pops are not needed here)
 30183                                  
 30184                                  	;push	si ; ?
 30185                                  	;push	ds ; ? 
 30186                                  	;push	es
 30187                                  	;push	bx ; *	
 30188                                  
 30189                                  	; 09/04/2019
 30190                                  	; !!! No need to save es,bx,ds,si above !!! (es,bx are changed here)
 30191                                  
 30192                                  	mov	ah,GET_IN_VARS		; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 30193                                  	int	21h
 30194                                  
 30195                                  	mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 30196                                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 30197                                  	je	short uhE		; If it's 0xFFFF, it's an error...
 30198                                  
 30199                                  	clc				; Else, it isn't (CLC done by prev cmp)
 30200                                  	;jmp	short uhX
 30201                                  	; 12/12/2022
 30202                                  	retn
 30203                                  uhE:	
 30204                                  	stc
 30205                                  uhX:	
 30206                                  	;pop	bx ; *
 30207                                  	;pop	es
 30208                                  	;pop	ds ; ?
 30209                                  	;pop	si ; ?
 30210                                  	retn
 30211                                  
 30212                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30213                                  ;*** isSysMCB - sets ZF if ES points to an MCB owned by "SC" + (8 or 9)
 30214                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30215                                  ; ENTRY:  ES:0 should point to a valid MCB
 30216                                  ; EXIT:   ZF set if owned by SC+8 or SC+9 (for japan)
 30217                                  ; USES:   Flags
 30218                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30219                                  
 30220                                  isSysMCB:
 30221                                  	;push	ax
 30222                                  
 30223                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; Check the owner...
 30224                                  	;cmp	ax,SystemPSPOwner	; 8 (for US OR Japan) is valid
 30225                                  	;je	short ism10
 30226                                  	;cmp	ax,JapanPSPOwner	; 9 (for Japan) is valid
 30227                                  	;;je	short ism10
 30228                                  	;;jmp	short ismX		; Anything else isn't.
 30229                                  	;jne	short ismX
 30230                                  	cmp	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],SystemPSPOwner ; 8  ; 09/04/2019
 30231                                  	jne	short ismX 
 30232                                  ism10:	
 30233                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.NAME]	; Check the name...
 30234                                  	;cmp	ax,'SC' ; 4353h
 30235                                  	cmp	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC'
 30236                                  ismX:	
 30237                                  	;pop	ax
 30238                                  	retn
 30239                                  
 30240                                  ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30241                                  
 30242                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30243                                  ;*** AddrToUmb - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB number
 30244                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30245                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a segment address
 30246                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain the UMB number which contains the address (0==conv)
 30247                                  ; ERROR:  If the address is above UM Range, AX will return as FFFF.
 30248                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 30249                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30250                                  ; An address in the following areas is treated as:
 30251                                  ;    0      <-> umbhead (0x9FFF)          = Conventional memory
 30252                                  ;    0x9FFF <-> addr of first UM sys MCB  = UMB #1
 30253                                  ;      ...
 30254                                  ;    addr of last UM sys MCB <-> TOM      = invalid; returns #0xFFFF
 30255                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30256                                  
 30257                                  AddrToUmb:
 30258                                  	push	cx
 30259                                  	push	dx
 30260                                  	push	es
 30261                                  
 30262                                  	mov	dx,ax		; DX = address to search for
 30263                                  
 30264                                  	call	UmbHead		; AX = first segment
 30265                                  	jc	short atuE	; If it couldn't get it, error out.
 30266                                  
 30267                                  	; 14/08/2023
 30268                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *	; ES = first UMB segment
 30269                                  	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now... (cx = UMB#)
 30270                                  
 30271                                  	; 22/07/2023
 30272                                  atu10:
 30273                                  	mov	es,ax ; * ; ** ; 14/08/2023
 30274                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 30275                                  ; ATU10--ES - Current MCB address
 30276                                  ;        DX - Address given for conversion
 30277                                  ;        CX - Current UMB #
 30278                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 30279                                  
 30280                                  ;atu10:	
 30281                                  	;mov	ax,es ; * ; 14/08/2023
 30282                                          cmp	ax,dx		; Present segment >= given segment?
 30283                                  	jae	short atuX	; Yep--done.
 30284                                  
 30285                                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if this is a system MCB
 30286                                  	jnz	short atu20
 30287                                  
 30288                                  	inc	cx		; If it _was_ a system MCB, we're in a new UMB.
 30289                                  atu20:	
 30290                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 30291                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end  ; 'Z'
 30292                                  	; 14/08/2023
 30293                                  	; ax = es
 30294                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 30295                                  	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30296                                  	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end
 30297                                  	je	short atu30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 30298                                  
 30299                                  	;NextMCB es,ax
 30300                                  
 30301                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 30302                                  	;;add	ax,[es:3]
 30303                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30304                                  	inc	ax
 30305                                  	; 14/08/2023
 30306                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *
 30307                                  	jmp	short atu10
 30308                                  
 30309                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30310                                  ; if we get to atu30, they specified a number that was past the last MCB.
 30311                                  ; make sure it's not _inside_ that MCB before we return an error condition.
 30312                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30313                                  
 30314                                  atu30:	
 30315                                  	; 14/08/2023
 30316                                  	; ax = es + [es:ARENA.SIZE] 
 30317                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 30318                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE] ; **
 30319                                  	cmp	ax,dx		; Present >= given?
 30320                                  	jae	short atuX	; Yep! It _was_ inside.
 30321                                  atuE:	
 30322                                  	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Else, fall through with UMB # == -1
 30323                                  	dec	cx		; (that makes it return 0xFFFF and sets CF)
 30324                                  atuX:	
 30325                                  	mov	ax,cx		; Return the UMB number in AX
 30326                                  	
 30327                                  	pop	es	
 30328                                  	pop	dx
 30329                                  	pop	cx
 30330                                  	retn
 30331                                  
 30332                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30333                                  ;*** convUMB - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 30334                                  ;            -- if GetXNum read a hex number, we interperete that as a segment
 30335                                  ; address rather than a UMB number... and use that address to look up a UMB.
 30336                                  ; This routine checks for that condition and calls AddrToUmb if necessary.
 30337                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30338                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a UMB number or segment, gnradix has been set by GetXNum
 30339                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain a UMB number
 30340                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30341                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 30342                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30343                                  
 30344                                  convUMB:
 30345                                  	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 30346                                  	jne	short cu10	; If it didn't read in hex, it's not an address
 30347                                  	call	AddrToUmb	; Else, convert the address to a UMB number
 30348                                  ;cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 30349                                  	;jne	short cu10
 30350                                  	;inc	ax		; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 30351                                  	; 14/08/2023
 30352                                  	inc	ax
 30353                                  	jz	short cu10	; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 30354                                  	dec	ax
 30355                                  cu10:	
 30356                                  	retn
 30357                                  
 30358                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30359                                  ;*** setUMBs - links umbs and sets allocation strategy for a load
 30360                                  ;            -- if LoadHigh, the allocation strategy MAY be LOW_FIRST instead
 30361                                  ; of the usual HIGH_FIRST.  See the code.
 30362                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30363                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 30364                                  ; EXIT:   None
 30365                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30366                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 30367                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30368                                  
 30369                                  setUMBs:
 30370                                  	push	ax
 30371                                  	push	bx
 30372                                  	call	fm_link
 30373                                  	pop	bx
 30374                                  	pop	ax
 30375                                  	retn
 30376                                  
 30377                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30378                                  ;*** loadLow - returns AL==0 if UMB0 == 0, else AL==1
 30379                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30380                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 30381                                  ; EXIT:   AL==0 if mem strategy should be set to LOW_FIRST, else AL==1
 30382                                  ;         Carry set if UMB0 not specified (_NOT_ an error)
 30383                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30384                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 30385                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30386                                  ; We want to set the memory strategy to LOW_FIRST if the user specified a
 30387                                  ; load UMB, and it is 0.  That 0 can be either from the user having _specified_
 30388                                  ; zero (/L:0;...), or from having specified a too-big min size (/L:1,99999999)
 30389                                  ; such that the load UMB is too small, and shouldn't be used.
 30390                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30391                                  
 30392                                  loadLow:
 30393                                  	;push	ds
 30394                                  	;push	cs		; Point DS into appropriate data segment
 30395                                  	;pop	ds	
 30396                                  
 30397                                  	;mov	al,[UmbLoad]
 30398                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad]
 30399                                  	cmp	al,UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh, -1
 30400                                  	jne	short ll10
 30401                                  
 30402                                  	stc
 30403                                  ll15:
 30404                                  	mov	al,1		; Return with AL==1 && STC if no UMBs specified
 30405                                  	;stc
 30406                                  	;jmp	short llX
 30407                                  	retn
 30408                                  ll10:	
 30409                                  	or	al,al		; AL=the load UMB: Is it == 0?
 30410                                  	;jz	short llX	; Yep... CF==0 (from OR) && AL=0, so just exit
 30411                                  
 30412                                  	jnz	short ll15	; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30413                                  	retn
 30414                                  
 30415                                  	;mov	al,1
 30416                                  	;clc
 30417                                  ;llX:
 30418                                  	;pop	ds		; Return DS to where it was
 30419                                  	;retn
 30420                                  
 30421                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30422                                  ;*** HideUMBs - links UMBs and hides upper-memory as appropriate
 30423                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30424                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 30425                                  ; EXIT:   None
 30426                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30427                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 30428                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30429                                  
 30430                                  HideUMBs:
 30431                                  	push	ax
 30432                                  	push	cx
 30433                                  	push	ds
 30434                                  	push	es
 30435                                  
 30436                                  	call	UmbTest		; See if we REALLY linked in anything...
 30437                                  	jc	short husX	; ...if not, there's nothing for us to do.
 30438                                  
 30439                                  	call	FixMem		; Concatenate adjacent free MCBs in upper mem
 30440                                  	call	setUMBs		; Link UMBs and set memory-allocation strategy
 30441                                  
 30442                                  	;putdata fInHigh,1	; Remember that we're now running high
 30443                                  	mov	byte [cs:fInHigh],1
 30444                                  
 30445                                  	;call	GetLoadUMB	; See if they gave us a list to leave free
 30446                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad] ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30447                                  
 30448                                  	cmp	al,UNSPECIFIED	; If they didn't,
 30449                                  	je	short husX	; then we shouldn't do this loop:
 30450                                  
 30451                                  	xor	cx,cx
 30452                                  
 30453                                  ; -----------------------------------------------
 30454                                  ; HUS10-CX - UMB number (after inc, 1==first UMB)
 30455                                  ; -----------------------------------------------
 30456                                  
 30457                                  hus10:	inc	cx		; For each UMB:
 30458                                  	cmp	cx,MAXUMB ; 16
 30459                                  	jae	short hus20
 30460                                  
 30461                                  	mov	al,cl		; (stopping as soon as we're outside of the
 30462                                  	push	es
 30463                                  	call	findUMB		; valid range of UMBs)
 30464                                  	pop	es		; push/pop: trash what findumb finds.  :-)
 30465                                  	jc	short hus20
 30466                                  
 30467                                  	call	_hideUMB_	; hide what we need to hide.
 30468                                  
 30469                                  	jmp	short hus10
 30470                                  hus20:
